11.content:
Rebecca Chambers was wondering how in the heck she got into this mess. She was only a rookie in the S.T.A.R.S. Bravo team, yet she was now stuck in an abandoned train in the middle of the woods, filled with dead bodies, and possibly refuge to an escaped war criminal.

Oh, and she just shot a zombie.

It all seemed ridiculous to her. The deserted private train car, she could accept, and even all of the dead passengers weren't too upsetting.

But a moving, groaning, chomping corpse?

It was a bit much for the young rookie, just recently assigned the position of rear security. The title somewhat fit her, for one of the qualities one might at first notice about the young woman was her rather cushy ass filling out that uniform.

This made it difficult as Rebecca whimpered and delicately attempted to step around the beast she just put down while keeping her pistol at the ready...

12.content:
Raccoon City. Once an ordinary mid-western city, fueled by the successes of one of the largest pharmaceutical corporations in the world, Umbrella Chemical Inc. Now it was nothing better than a war zone, hell on earth, its population converted into mindless zombies while the city burned and the few survivors desperately tried to get out. And stuck in the middle of this chaos was Jill Valentine.

Jill had a far better chance than your average person of making it out of this city alive. She was only twenty-four years old, but had been a veteran of S.T.A.R.S. for years and was as deadly as she was beautiful. Unfortunately, she was caught by this outbreak of the undead unprepared, wearing only her blue tube top, black miniskirt, and boots. She was also severely under armed, having to pick off individual zombies with her pistol.

"Dammit, I can't keep going like this..." She panted, backing down an alley and firing at a stumbling horde of zombies approaching her, "I need to find a way to escape...."
12.title: Jill Valentine

choices: A large, pristine, and sterile hospital bedroom.
A rather lavish-looking penthouse quarters.
Actually, she was in one of Umbrella's underground labs...
124.content:
As many would say: "It was only a matter of time before your luck ran out".

Jill knew that better than some, given what she went through back in the Arklay Mountains.

Though...she kinda wish it didn't run out now.

Currently, she was sprinting away from a small of well-trained group of armed soldiers, most likely lackeys from the insidious Umbrella Corporation.

"-- There she is! Don't let her escape! --" One of them yelled, as they chased her into the alleyways of the now chaotic streets of Raccoon City. Jill ducked and weaved to avoid their shots, her mind circulating as to why they would want her alive all of a sudden.

However, there would be no time for such contemplation, as Jill came crashing down onto the pavement, hit by what she could only assume to be a drugged tranq dart of sorts.

Her vision was fading. Her muscles were going numb. She tried to crawl away, only for her body to give out on her, as the last words she heard before losing consciousness were, "-- This is Wolf-Pack. We've captured her. Bringing her to the Cradle now. --"

And with that, the only thing greeting Jill for the time being...was darkness, unaware of what her fate will be.

== The Cradle ==
== Undisclosed Location, Raccoon City ==
== September 25th, 1998 ==

Slowly but surely, Jill eventually began to regain consciousness. Her body still felt slightly numb, as she sluggishly attempted to sit up from where she laid. Her head throbbing up a storm, as she grasped her front lobe, only muttering, "Where...Wh-Where the hell am I?"

Her vision was still foggy, which soon began to dilate back into focus. Once she regained her vision once more, the S.T.A.R.S member found herself in...
124.title: Subject Found

choices: It was a custom lab, with several small containment tubes.
It was a woman with a respirator mask on her face.
Actually, Jill saw something else instead...
1242.content:
Her vision was still slightly hazy, but it was enough to make out her surroundings.

"...Wha...Wh-Where am I?" Jill weakly questioned, as she took note of her current environs.

Surprisingly, it was a rather lavish-looking bedroom, akin to what you would normally find within a posh hotel or inn. Suffice to say, Jill couldn't help but feel quite uneasy, considering it reminded her all-too-much of the Spencer Mansion. From there, her ears soon picked up the distant sounds of gunfire off in the distance.

"Gotta...Find...Help..." She weakly said, attempting to stand up of her own volition, only to find herself on a rather shaky foundation, stumbling onto the floor in the process. But after a few more attempts, she was able to barely stand on her own two feet, to which she shakily made her way to the door before her.

Grasping the doorknob with both hands, Jill struggled to turn the knob due to her being in such a weakened state, only for the door to swiftly open forward, causing her to fall onto the floor with a muffled thud. Stubborn as ever, the brunette weakly stood back up onto her feet, slowly making her way through the hallway, with a hand on the wall for balance.

Eventually, once she made it to the end of the hall, Jill soon began to smell something...delicious?

No! It wasn't that! She said to herself, shaking her head in the process out of initial denial, only for the aroma to hit her sinuses once more, causing her mouth to salivate instinctively.

Gritting her teeth, Jill impulsively made her way out of the hallway and into the main area of what she can see is an extravagant penthouse, with the sparsely burning flickering of the buildings of the doomed Raccoon City not too far off in the distance from her view.

But it wasn't what she saw over the nightly horizon that garnered her attention, but rather...
1242.title: Subject Awake

choices: She seemed to be getting better (Virus-related weight gain & slight TF).
She was slowly getting fatter (Virus-related weight gain).
Actually, it was a mix of both!
12422.content:
Panting some as she attempted to catch her breath, Jill soon came across a rather distinct individual.

Judging from the person's appearance, Jill was able to tell that it was a woman, judging from the familiar curves of the female gender. However, what made the staggering S.T.A.R.S member uneasy was the woman's clothing.

She wore a pristine lab coat over a sleek-looking military-grade bodysuit, with ammunition pouches and straps adorned on her legs and hip-line. At first, the strange woman didn't seem to notice Jill's presence. That is, until she turned around to look through a microscope.

It was there that Jill got a good look at the woman's face. She had the distinctive features of someone of Asian descent, wearing a compact respirator around her mouth and nose.

Unfortunately for the currently fragile Jill, this strange woman soon took notice of her, casually walking up to her as she said, "-- Oh good! You're awake, Ms. Valentine! --"

Acting upon instinct, Jill tried to futilely defend herself from this unknown assailant, which proved fruitless as the masked woman casually hoisted the brunette's arm over her shoulder to support the physically frail woman.

"-- Easy there, Ms. Valentine. No use trying to defend yourself, I'm afraid. --" The woman retorted, as if being all too friendly with her like they knew each other, where the woman calmly placed Jill onto a sturdy chair, with Jill only mustering enough strength to ask, "Who...Wh-Who are...you?"

As the masked woman then examined the creatures in the containment tubes, jotting down several research notes in the process, she promptly answered back, "-- Who me? ...Think of me as an ally, Ms. Valentine? --"

"-- Here. Eat this. --" The woman said, holding up a slice of cake, something Jill thought she wouldn't see much of due to what had transpired in Raccoon City. Feeling like she wasn't given a choice, Jill reluctantly took the slice of cake with both hands due to her currently weakened state, taking large messy bites of the sweet in the span of four long minutes.

And much to her own surprise...
12422.title: Subject "Safe"

choices: Reluctantly, Jill began to devour the cake slices with gusto.
Defiant to the end, Jill refused to eat.
But then, something else happened instead...
124221.content:
Much to her own surprise, as she devoured the slice of cake, Jill quickly noticed that she was starting to regain her strength little by little, as the awful numb feeling started to dissipate, thus putting an astounded upward curve of her lips upon her face.

"I...I-I actually feel a lot better. Thanks!" Jill stated, looking at her heavily dressed compatriot, to which the woman then pulled out another tray, this time with a few more slices of cake adorned on the metallic slab. In response, the masked woman soon replied, "-- Not a problem, Ms. Valentine. After all, you looked rather malnourished when we found you. --"

"We? ...Wait a minute--" Jill realized, quickly jumping to the conclusion that this woman was probably with those gas mask-wearing soldiers that were chasing her earlier. Instinctively, she swiftly grabbed a nearby scalpel from the table, holding it in front of her in a defensive posture while she exclaimed, "--You're with those soldiers, aren't you?!"

Obviously taking heed of her "guest's" threatened stance, the woman raised her hands some in a non-threatening gesture, turning around to face the scalpel-wielding Jill Valentine and answered, "-- Smart girl. You're definitely a cut above the rest, that's for sure! --"

"Shut up!! Who the hell are you?! And where am I?" Jill yelled, interrogating the masked woman before her, to which the woman slowly walked toward her, hands still above her head, as she spoke once more and explained, "-- Well, since you seem so intent to seek answers, I'll provide them. My name is Christine Yamata. I'm a Virologist working for Umbrella- Scratch that! I USED to work for Umbrella, as part of their Umbrella Security Services. Though, you can call me "Four Eyes" if you're feeling nasty. --"

"I knew it! Those were Umbrella's goons that attacked me!" Jill thought, where she then refocused back upon the woman, now known as Four Eyes, and questioned, "...What do you want with me?"

"-- Like I said, I don't work for Umbrella these days. Same with my colleagues Vector, Beltway, Lupo, Bertha, and Spectre. Anyway, we're currently at the Apple Inn, which we made a temporary base in the wake of our... "defection" from Umbrella. --" Four Eyes explained, which seemed to ease Jill's nerves a little, whilst the small twinges of hunger began to sluggishly crawl up Jill's insides, as the former S.T.A.R.S member quickly said, "...Okay, I believe you. But! That still doesn't explain what you're planning to do with me!"

But then, like taking a bullet to the gut, Jill suddenly felt these painful hunger pangs coming from her stomach, causing her to keel over onto the floor, grasping her flat stomach in pain, gritting her teeth in the process.

"-- You were infected with the T-Virus by one of Umbrella's creations. Fortunately, I gave you a dose of something special I cooked up to counteract this. --" Four Eyes elaborated, calmly walking up to Jill, and carefully taking the scalpel from her hand, only to receive Jill's scolding as she yelled, "...Wh-What... Did you do to me?! AAAGH!!"

Jill knelt down in pain, to which Four Eyes then kindly grabbed a slice of cake from the tray, presenting it to her akin to a peace offering, while she answered, "-- I call it... "The T-Nebu Virus." I know you don't exactly trust me right now, but you need to eat, Ms. Valentine. Otherwise, the virus I concocted will just consume your body's muscle cells for sustenance. You see, it feeds on the body's fat cells and accumulates them to maintain a healthy host. And right now... --"

Four Eyes calmly presented the cake slice in front of Jill's face and continued, "-- ...If you want to get back at Umbrella for all the trouble they caused, I recommend you start digging in. Like it or not, it's your choice. --"
124221.title: Subject Infected

choices: From there, Four Eyes gave Jill a special bracelet used to monitor her.
But then, one of Four Eye's comrades came in. But what for?
Actually, something else happened instead...
1242211.content:
At first, Jill outright defied Four Eye's assistance, not wanting to possibly mutate into some horrific monster. And yet, the painful hunger pangs continued their relentless result on her senses, thus making it all the more difficult to resist.

Inevitably, left with little choice in the matter, Jill brashly swiped the cake slice from the masked woman's gloved hand, violently chewing down on the fluffy cuisine with gusto, still bearing a stern reluctant expression with her eyes.

Underneath her respirator, Four Eyes smiled a little at this change of events, especially considering that she can now properly see the eventual effects of her counter-virus, to which she then casually retorted, "-- Good girl, Ms. Valentine. I knew you would make the right choice. --"

"Just shut up and hand me the tray." Jill growled, obviously not wanting her supposed captor to have some cathartic satisfaction with turning her into the woman's personal guinea pig. However, she was willing to make the Umbrella Corporation pay for all the suffering they've caused, so she unwillingly swallows her pride while she went for the next cake slice, nearly oblivious to the eventual side-effects of the T-Nebu Virus would have on her in the near future, as her body very slowly began to "fill out" as they say.

== 18 Minutes Later... ==

Pain.

That was the only thing she felt at the moment.

Jill was currently laying on a nearby couch, her belly painfully distended to near-bursting, as she felt this odd numbing sensation in certain areas. However, she could only focus on the pain she was feeling in her stomach region.

Meanwhile, Four Eyes was busily examining Jill's unwilling food baby, jotting down notes as to how her homemade virus would take an effect on Jill, along with any potential mutations she might potentially undergo, responding with a cheekily quip as she chirped, "-- How are you feeling, Ms. Valentine? Are there any other discomforts besides the obvious? --"

Jill could only respond with a frustrated glare for the moment, her hands currently preoccupied with grasping her stomach.
1242211.title: Subject Hungers

choices: Claire finds her way into the diner
She continues down the alleyway and is attacked
She heads back where she came
Claire is suddenly knocked unconsious
Claire runs into somebody
13.content:
Even before she entered the city limits, Claire Redfield sensed that something wasn't right in Raccoon City. She had come to this unassuming Midwestern metropolis searching for her brother and close friend Chris, but as she rode in on her motorcycle that night, other things were on her mind. She expected such a huge town to be busy as hell, but she hadn't even passed a single car since arriving in here.

Then she slowed to a stop as she saw a tanker truck fallen on its side, blocking the entire street and decked out in yellow police tape.

"Great! Now how the hell do I find my way around this mess..." She groaned, parking her hog and looking around until she spotted a nearby diner, "Might as well ask someone for directions."

It took about a minute for the girl to realize the door was locked tight, even though she could see somebody behind the counter, cleaning the floor. So she did the only thing she could think of and started banging on the glass.

"Hello!? Can you hear me? I'm trying to find my brother, can you show me the way out of here? Hello!" She stopped after a few minutes, grumbling, "Fantastic, the only person I've seen in this entire damn city, and he's an asshole."

She walked into the adjacent alleyway, either to find the backdoor or just a way around.
13.title: Claire Redfield

choices: ...that the person was gone, but there was a large stack of boxes fulla cookies
...a rather obese young woman.
...somebody pointing a gun at her!
131.content:
Claire was absolutely determined to find some way into that dinner. She wasn't even sure why, whether it was the rudeness of the person inside, her curiosity, or just because she had nothing better to do. She went into the alleyway leading behind the place and quickly found the backdoor wide open.

"Here we go, this is waaaay too easy," She said, grinning to herself.

She stepped through the door and into the back room of the dinner, walking through the kitchen and into the restaurant proper where she saw....
131.title: She has to get in somehow....

choices: Claire heads directly to the police station.
Claire goes to Kendo's shop.
Some other path
1313.content:
Quite a surprise awaited Claire once she got back into the diner's main room. A young man in a wet jacket took one look at and pulled a pistol on her! Claire instinctively placed her hands into the air.

"Don't shoot." Claire screamed.

"Get down!" The young man responded. Claire didn't know why he said that, but she followed the man's sight and ducked to her right. A bullet whizzed past her head and blew a hole into something. Claire turned around and gasped at the sight of a man with a very large hole in his head. On closer inspection she did see that he appeared almost...rotten in appearance. With red marks of blood ,some parts of his scalp missing, and a few teeth knocked out of his head.

"What?" She questioned. The young man bolted right over to her and grabbed a hold of Claire's arm.

"Come on!" He screamed. Off to the side of her, Claire hear hands smack against the diner's glass. She turned to the side to see more slackjawed citizens who shared similarities to the man who was ventilated behind her.

"What are these things?" Claire cried out.

"I don't know. But we're safer at the police station." The stranger answered. The two ran opposite to the way Claire entered, though now both were out in the open. Now whether it was the sound of their footsteps or the sound of the stranger's gunfire,who could've had said. But to get to the gist of the matter, a horde of the rotten came shambling out of overturned cars or broken windows. The stranger and Claire looked around until the man pointed at a police cruiser.

"There!" He shouted. The two ran towards it,both dodged hands that could've held them tight.Both tugged at the handles and hoped they opened. Luck smiled down onto them and the two rushed inside. Fate also seemed to give the two a helping hand as the key to the ignition was still in its slot. The man floored it to the max. He drove off, Claire looked behind her to see the slowly shrinking forms of the dead mass.

The two breathed a sigh of relief as the sped through the city streets.

"I'm Leon." The man spoke. "Leon.S.Kennedy."

"Claire Redfield." Claire responded. " Nice to meet you."

Leon smiled back at her. "Could you check in the glove department?"

Claire stared at Leon for a bit but complied, there a glock greeted her. She grabbed a hold of it to stare at its design. She also made sure that no bullets were chambered.

"Take it, you may wan-" Leon began to speak but was interrupted by Claire.

"Use it? Because if you're saying I shouldn't." She joked. "So who are you anyways?

"Currently a bum,was going to be a rookie today. At the police station." Leon absentmindedly spoke as he kept his eyes on the road. Claire was about to say something else but was stopped by the sound of a blaring horn behind her. She turned around and gasped at the sight of a truck crashing through the road. Leon saw the sight as well and cursed,he tried to maneuver out the way of wrecked cars while seeing the ever barring sight of the truck.

"Crazy son of a bitch." Leon spoke. He stopped and Claire grunted in surprise. She was about to ask why they stopped until she saw the sight of a overturned gas-carrier.

"Get out!" Leon cried. He helped unbuckle Claire's seat-belt before he did his own. The two rolled out of the car and just in time for the truck to ram straight into the cruiser and in turn ignite the gas-tank. The explosion knocked the two away,though thankfully both were relatively unharmed. A small bruise and scrap were on Claire but she tanked it.

"Leon!" She cried.

"Here!" Leon answered. The two walked forward,doing their best not to touch the spreading inferno.

"The police station is just down the road." He spoke. He pointed to his right. "Its behind that building all the way at the end of the street. You're closer to it, so just follow the directions and you'll get there in ten or so minutes."

"What about you?" Claire questioned.

Leon turned and pointed to the alley right behind him. "I'll see where this will take me. I'll be fine!"

Claire had many questions she wanted to ask but the sound of an agitated crowd of carrion eaters,as well as the heating inferno put a pause onto those thoughts. Claire turned her head around to see where she could go. Besides the street being filled with wreckage, it seemed that horde was coming behind her and that no drooling beasts were hidden in the field of ruin. She then looked to her left side to see a weather-torn advertisement which showed the name Kendo written on it. An arrow pointed to an alleyway which still had its lights on. Claire hopefully could've banked on the chance that someone was still there,or at least, give her a safer way to get to the police station.
1313.title: ...somebody pointing a gun at her!

choices: Claire encounters a...plant? A walking plant at that
Claire travels through the alleyways unharmed.
13132.content:
Who knows how long it would've taken her if she gone through the ruined street? She also didn't want to bank on any hidden biters to grab onto her ankles. So Claire trusted the advertisement's words that Kendo's shop was still open. The young brunette sprinted forward, she glimpsed behind herself to quickly note the incoming shamblers.

She ran through the alleyway's lights, the sight was somewhat comforting to the woman. Claire followed the path outlined by tthe name Kendo in bright white with a blue arrow background. Soon she arrived right in front of the store. "Kendo Brothers Armaments and Supplies" proudly flashed in neon, or in this case,burnt neon.

Claire hesitantly grabbed a hold of the door handle and pushed forward. She slowly crept her way into the store.

"Freeze!" A voice said. It wasn't loud,but the tone of authority made Claire instantly seize up. She looked at the counter to see a middle age man, hefty in the middle but still fit somewhat fit, aiming a crossbow at her. He showed sighs of having some Japanese ancestry in him,but besides that he appeared like any other Mid-Western American.

"Don't shoot!" Claire said the second time this night. "I'm not one of them."

The large man looked surprised at that, he lowered his weapon and paced towards Claire. She stiffened then relaxed as she saw him lock the door behind Claire.

She heard him mumble about bought locks and other things. The man put down his crossbow onto the counter and stared at Claire.

"Robert Kendo." He introduced himself. "I haven't seen you around."

"Claire Redfield. And if you don't know me,well, that's because I've just arrived here."

"Redfield?" Robert's eyes widened at her surname.He seemed to calm down even more so at that."I know your brother!"

"You do?" Claire asked. "How? Where is he?"

"I personally make the city's S.T.A.R unit's weapons. Well,me and my brother anyways, and he's out of town. As to where he is, I don't know. I'd have a word with him if I did however." Robert grumbled. Claire slumped down at his words.

"Although,you can try the police station,maybe that's where he's at."

Claire brightened a little from his statement. She was going there anyways, but the chance that Chris could've been there was reassuring.

"Do you know what's going on with the city,Mr. Kendo?"

Robert scratched the back of his head while he inspected his crossbow. A huff of air came from out of his nose.

"I wish I knew. Once I even knew there was something wrong, the whole town's been infested by zombies."

Claire internalized that tidbit however other matters took priority in her mind. She needed to head towards the police station and find some answers.

"Thank you so much. Its been nice chatting with you but I have to leave. I can let myself out the front door if you don't mind."

"Wait. I'll lead you out back. My shop's leads right into alleyways. You follow ever twist and turn and you'll be at the police station's ...east wing? I can't exactly remember at the moment." Robert explained as he moved away from the counter. Claire followed the man until she back outside. A wire fence stood before her, to her left she saw a closed door. Robert took a keychain out,he popped a key into the socket,twisted,the distinct sound of an unlocked mechanism echoed through the air.

"Thank you,again." Claire said. "Why don't you come with me? If the police are still around, maybe we can bunker down with them?"

"Nah. My store's my fortress. It has everything I need; food,water,ammo,and enough guns to- well it had enough guns until the looters came two days ago. I also have some other...obligations I need to finish."

Robert disappeared and Claire was just about to open the door that lead out of the wire fence. But Kendo walked back out with some ammunition. He threw the packages at her, Claire grabbed them straight from the air.

"Here, a safety precaution." The gunsmith stated.

Claire smiled and walked away from Kendo's shop. Into the unknown she went, hopefully nothing would attack on her journey to the station.
13132.title: Claire goes to Kendo's shop.

choices: A gigantic blob!
A morbidly obese woman...?
A creature infected with a mysterious new virus...
132.content:
Claire continued to walk deeper and deeper into the dark, foreboding alley, hoping that it would take her around the wreckage strewn about the street behind her. The alleyway was long, and not only that, but it twisted in odd paths and branched off in different directions. Needless to say, it made the young redhead nervous.

"Geeze, this is like something out of those horror movies me and Chris used to watch...." She whimpered. She always found that she felt less afraid when talking to herself, but it wasn't helping too much in this situation, "Don't freak out Claire, you're a strong girl, you can deal with any moron that tries to take you down..."

Despite her confident words, her heart stopped as she heard a loud rattling noise. She quickly looked down the alleyway to her left and saw that a metal backdoor was shaking violently as something from within pounded against it.

Claire wasn't bragging when she said that she kick any attacker's ass. If anybody tried to mug or rape her, they'd more than likely end up on the ground with a few good broken bones, but just in case, she grabbed a nearby pipe off of the ground as she faced the door, a door that was about to come flying open in a matter of seconds and reveal...
132.title: What was that....?

choices: ...swings the pipe at it, hoping to injure the amorphous beast.
...runs the hell away.
...calls out for help.
1321.content:
As she turned to face the door, readying herself for whatever was behind it, it flung off of its hinges with amazing force, crashing into a nearby wall as the creature within pour out into the street.

The thing was massive, intimidating, and.... slimy. It appeared to be some sort of living mass of what looked like dough, a monster with no distinguishing features other than is large, squishy bulk. Yet, despite its lack of eyes, ears, or any other sensory organ, it still seemed to notice Claire, for as soon as it was free from the building it began to rapidly ooze toward the shocked woman....

Claire...
1321.title: The Slime monster attacks!

choices: The blob takes advantage of her open mouth...
The blob enters through another way
13211.content:
After the initial shock wore off, Claire gasped in alarm, realizing that the monster was quickly closing ground on her. She responded by raising her pipe into the air and just as the monster sent out a thick tentacle in her direction, she brought the improvised weapon down on it. "No!" Claire whimpered, "you...huff...you can't!" The doppelganger paused once more before turning around with a smirk.

"Oh but I already have." The doppelganger put a hand to its chin in thought, "however, I must admit that it wouldn't do for me to search the entire city alone..." The doppelganger looked upwards, only for it to catch sight of something and grin "however, I don't think that will be a problem come a few hours more."

"What...huff...are you..." Claire wheezed as she followed the doppelgangers eyes to the right, only for them to widen in terror at the sight of about five moderately sized blobs peering over the edge of the building, their focus seeming to be centered right on her. "No..." Claire whined pitifully, "please..."

"Oh come now Claire," the doppelganger chided, "it's rude to refuse some new guests your hospitality just after serving me! After all..." It paused, watching the other blobs start to make a beeline for the helpless, fattened Claire, before turning its back on the ensuing engorgement. "the more Claire Redfields, the merrier..."

Claire herself tried desperately to keep her mouth shut, however, against her own will she felt her mouth open up to greddily accept the group of blobs making their way towards her gigantic form, no doubt due to the influence of her doppelganger.

Once the first blob made its way to her mouth she could only accept her fate as she felt her belly once again surge forward as she started packing the pounds back on. However, the other blobs, impatient as ever, saught to enter her from every place the could, and Claire could only moan as waves of immense pleasure rolled over her throughout the entire process. As the blobs kept coming Claire noted that she must have passed her previous weight and size, before her eyes once again rolled up into her head as she passed out cold.

Later...
13211112211211.title: She wakes up... hours later...

choices: Jill hears the sound of an approaching blob pack! Seems her instincts were right
Jill cautiously joins up with the other Claire
132111122112111.content:
The sound of gunfire rang out within a building long abandoned after what seemed like a circle of hell had opened upon Racoon City. The mindless flesh eaters falling out now deader then dead after a single bullet to their rotting skulls.

Jill Valentine had survived one form of hell only to fall right back into another. The short-haired brunette having traded her STARS uniform for a more casual top and skirt but that didn't make her any less of a sharpshooter.

She needed to get out of this town reunite with her partner Chris Redfield and put Wesker's villainous betrayal behind her however all the monstrous madness that had befallen the city wasn't making things easy...not to mention that gigantic humanoid beast that seemed to be following her and like everything else she came across wanted nothing more to make a smear on the pavement.

Making her way out of the empty location Jill instinctively drew her gun out scanning the area for any nearby threats, while taking down those zombies wasn't too difficult she learned during her time in the mansion that not every monstrosity was slow and dumb.

With the coast clear for now she stepped right out into the damaged destruction-filled streets. There had to be a way out of town, reloading her gun she was determine to find it...

The other villainous Claire had been searching the streets of Racoon for some time now having left the original Redfield woman to be a factory for more of her kind ultimately uncaring of whatever fate befall the real Claire, all that matter was finding more usable hosts...unfortunately many of the women she came across had already been claimed by the monsters roaming the city.

"Useless" she muttered having snapped the neck of one such creature before tossing it aside with surprising ease that didn't match her physical build. Perhaps she shouldn't have rid herself of Claire so quickly.

However her eyes soon caught sight of a rather healthy young woman roaming the streets, the brunette was decently fit for her age and much like Claire she would be a fine "creator". Now all she had to do was win her trust.

"Excuse me, over here!"

She called out waving in the other woman's direction apparently doing enough to catch her attention.

Her aim steady Jill was slightly surprised to find another survivor, another brave woman even, closing the gap between them the brunette noted that this other girl didn't seem to be armed with anything nor was she showing any cuts or bruises perhaps she had been lucky in her travels?

"Hi there my name's Claire, I was hoping I would run into someone still alive out here."

The Other stated hoping to weasel her way into a friendship with Jill.

Claire? That sounded oddly familiar to her as if she had heard it somewhere before but between everything that had happened recently the woman's mind was at times working a million thoughts a minute.

"I'm Jill, Jill Valentine. Pleasure to meet you Claire, what exactly are you doing out here on your own?"

"I could ask you the same but more to the point looking for assistance."

To escape the city no doubt thought the brunette that said while thankful to have some company something about this woman gave her an odd feeling...it was eerie similar to Wesker, or maybe once again her mind was thinking far too fast for it's own good.
132111122112111.title: Fake Claire encounters another woman

choices: Can Jill successfully evade her blobby pursuers?
Meanwhile back with Claire...
1321111221121111.content:
Jill had seen and experienced a good deal during her time with STARS and the mansion incident had only sharpen her skills further, skills that allowed her to pick up on the sound of something approaching in on her location. Thankfully it didn't sound like it was that trench coat wearing monster from before but yet again it seemed it was going to have to be something she'd have to deal with.

The Other Claire noticing a slight change in demeanor was about to speak up when she suddenly found the barrel of a gun pointed straight at her.

"This isn't my first rodeo so you'd best tell me who or what you really are!"

The blobs were approaching and Jill knew the opening she had for questioning was quickly closing.

"Tell me, NOW!"

The Other standing silent for a moment before a devilish smirk began to form on her lips.

"What I am is irrelevant to you but I wasn't lying when I said I was looking for help...and you'll do just fine."

The slithering sound of blobs now even closer as Jill whipped her vision in their direction spotting a handful before locking eyes once again with the Other Claire...a moment later a bullet had pierced right through the side of her head!

There was no time to check if the damage done had been fatal instead Jill quickly reloaded her gun before taking off into a sprint firing several warning shots at the pack of blobs chasing after her.
1321111221121111.title: Things are not what they seem

choices: Jill wakes up, and continues onward.
The real Claire stumbles upon Jill!
13211112211211111.content:
Jill spared no time in breaking into a dead sprint through the nearby alleyways in an attempt to lose her slime-based pursuers.

"Can't let them box me in!" She muttered to herself as she heard the noise of multiple creatures slithering closely behind her. Hoping to confuse the blobs Jill took a swift turn to the right, deftly vaulting over the fence in one smooth motion.

Luckily, this seemed to impede the blobs as she heard them stop at the fence she had made it over, and then slither in another direction.

"Lost em for now I guess!" Jill sighed, relieved that she had managed to shake them off of her trail for the moment.

Heh, I wouldn't be so sure of that if I were you Ms. Valentine! The familiar voice of the doppelganger cackled as Jill whipped around to find 'Claire' sitting atop the fence, looking no worse for the wear, her head showing no signs of the bullet wound that should have been quite evident in her head.

"How?" Jill grimaced, gritting her teeth, "I put a bullet straight through your skull at point blank!"

"That you did!" 'Claire' nodded, flashing Jill a chesire grin in response, "and if I had been one of those insipid bags of rotten flesh roaming the city it would have been more than enough to end me!"

"So then if you're not one of those...things, what the hell are you?" Jill spat defiantly, while getting ready to run once more.

"Oh, you're already quite familiar with my kind." 'Claire' giggled, looking up, "and while I may not be as...slippery as my companions, I do have a knack for tactics, which by the way Ms. Valentine, I'm afraid your little escape ends here!"

Jill, too wary to break eye contact with 'Claire' for even a moment, was caught off guard as something collided with her foot, rooting it to the ground.

"Aw crap..." Jill swore as she looked down to find one of the blobs keeping her leg firmly connected to the ground. Looking up, Jill took aim once more at 'Claire' and prepared to open fire. Her finger was pulling the trigger just as another blob collided with her hand and knocked the gun away.

'Claire' was now directly in front of her, chuckling at Jill's futile attempts at resistance. Jill, noticing the amusement of her aggressor, growled and swung her fist, connecting solidly with 'Claire's' waist. Much to her horror however, her fist stuck after making contact with the other woman, and as she tried to pull it away, she found that she could not free her hand.

"Done yet?" 'Claire' inquired, smirking at her prey. "It amuses me to see you struggle, though I must say you at least put up more of a fight than the real Claire did!"

"Shut the hell up!" Jill yelled, noticing that the crowd of blobs from before had finally caught up and were heading for her. "You won't get awa- mmph!" Jill's shouts proved to be her undoing, as one of the blobs swiftly entered her mouth without hesitation.

Finally letting Jill's limbs go, 'Claire' looked on eagerly as the blobs began to stuff their newly acquired prey. The first blob simply made Jill a bit more chubby, her belly pooching out from underneath her sky blue top and her chest growing out to show some ample cleavage. The second blob turned Jill decidedly more into the fat category as her skirt began to show signs of strain. This was followed by a third and fourth blob until finally Jill was sitting at a whopping 450 pounds, panting heavily from the strain of her growth.

"What...huff...the...huff...hell" Jill breathed, her voice noticeably lower from the sheer girth that had accumulated on her frame.

"Hehe, only step one of what I've got in store for you Jill!" 'Claire' giggled, placing a finger on her chin in thought, "but you know, I'm a good sport, so I'll cut you a deal! If you can get out of this alley before I do I'll let you go!"

"Are you...huff...kidding me?" Jill groaned, glaring at the creature across from her.

"I'll even give you a ten second head start!" 'Claire' said, smiling in a sickeningly sweet manner.

As the creature started to count, Jill tried as best as she could to lift herself up to her feet, but quickly found that her muscles were much less prepared to lift 300 pounds of extra weight. Shakily, as the count hit four, Jill managed to move her legs under her and slowly lift herself off the ground. However, she almost immediatley stumbled, her center of gravity being much different than before, and to make matters worse, her top, loyal as it had been up to now, ripped apart, letting her now titanic breasts spill forth, covered just barely by a simple black bra she had worn underneath.

As the count hit six she shakily took a couple of steps forward, breathing heavily as she steadied herself on the wall. As the count hit eight she had managed to make it five steps, but was already panting from exhaustion and sweating heavily from the exertion a simple walk had placed upon her.

"Ten! Here I come!" Jill heard 'Claire' giggle, hearing the patter of footsteps behind her and then seeing the creature pass her, casually jogging in front of her to the alley exit, Jill dropping to her enlarged butt at the sight and letting out a groan from exhaustion.

"Well you tried your best, and hey even though you weren't the best runner," Claire smirked, "you'll make a fine creator!"

Without another second to spare Jill felt her mouth forced open once more, her eyes rolling in the back of her head as she fell unconscious. The last thing she felt was the proportions of her body, especially her belly, balloning even more.

An hour later...

As the now engorged figure of Jill Valentine lay comatose, her body, just like Claire's, was being copied genetically down to the smallest atom, and eventually her body convulsed a bit, before finally spitting up most of the blobs. Her form looking around 200 pounds after the process was finally complete. The blobs she had spat up however, began to form into two different figures.

The first one was none other than 'Claire', the entity that had landed Jill in her current predicament. Stretching and letting out a yawn, the doppelganger looked to the figure forming next to her and smiled in approval.

The second figure formed into a pale skinned girl with brown hair, a sky blue top, and a skirt to match, the faint red glow in her eyes the only indication of her non-human origin.

"Heh, I guess welcome to the team 'Jill'," 'Claire' greeted, extending a hand.

"Charmed and thrilled to be here 'Claire'" 'Jill' responded, shaking the other's hand and flashing a cold smile. "Should we dispose of the original?"

"Nah, I've got a much better idea." 'Claire' said, giving the unconscious form of Jill a calculating look. Extending her hand, 'Claire' broke off a portion of herself and stuffed it into Jill, who ingested one more. However, instead of expanding, Jill winced in pain, before twitching a little, her breathing stopped for a few moments, before resuming normally.

"What did you do?" 'Jill' inquired, curious as to the other's actions.

"Oh, I made that portion of me destroy her current brain and replace it with a working replica made up of me." 'Claire' shot the other doppelganger a triumphant smirk. "She'll still function as normal whenever she wakes up, but if she encounters one of us again well...let's just say she'll be a lot more compliant with our wishes...

"Terrific!" 'Jill' crowed, "now, shall we find others to spread our gift to?"

"With pleasure!" with that, both 'Claire' and 'Jill' walked away, a pack of blobs following closely behind each one of them.

Later...
13211112211211111.title: Evasive Maneuvers

choices: Meanwhile back with Claire...
The Other Claire and Jill continue on but just how solid is their partnership?
132111122112111111.content:
Unbeknown to the sinister blob "women" a figure had watched Jill's downfall play completely out from the top of a nearby roof. The individual could have made a move to save the brunette but that would give away their location to those...things and they had no intention of doing so, they were in this hellhole for their own reasons and had no time to deal with those creatures...but that didn't mean they couldn't leave a hint for the bloated brunette whenever she awoke...

Later when Jill did in fact begin to come around the bigger woman grunted in agony, her pounding like that time after she had first joined up with STARS and went out drinking with her partner Chris, old man Barry, sweet innocent Rebecca, and...that bastard Wesker...

!

She felt herself gasp out loud when she remembered the man's face which in turn made her remember what had just happened to her.

"Dammit"

She grumbled through her teeth not wanting to believe that she had fallen victim to another psycho's villainous methods. That woman, no monster played her like a fool just like her former captain had.

She would show her, even as she struggled to lift her heavier form off the cold pavement, Jill grunted and grumbling as her larger assists and belly flopped and jiggled thanks to the extra padding housed within her.

"Next time I get a chance I'm stuffing a damn grenade down that gullet of hers."

Jill stated as she wrapped her chubbier fingers around her fallen pistol, before the bullet to the head had been business now it was personal, gathering herself the bigger brunette's eyes came to spot an object embedded near her location.

It was...a bolt and on it was a some kind of note. Her eyes glaring as she didn't want to take a chance on anything anymore Jill bend at the knees, grunting as she did, and removed the slip of paper left to her.

"Your head is not what it seems. Avoid those monstrosities."

What the hell did that mean? She thought rubbing her second going on third chin, her head outside of pounding like a bass drum felt fine but someone went through the trouble to warn her nonetheless.

In any case she took a moment to reload her pistol along with readjust what could of her skirt and her basic black bra afterwards deciding to keep the warning literally close to her heart she stuffed the folded up note into her cleavage.

Eying the mysterious bolt one last time Jill took in a breath before moving on, as much as she simply wanted to leave town she had to stop that thing by any means.
132111122112111111.title: Jill wakes up fatter, angrier, and to a warning?

choices: It's a blob...that Claire can control!
A massive burp and nothing more. Is Claire safe for now?
1321111221121111111.content:
While Jill had experienced a run in with the blob born doppelganger the creature's original host had problems of her own. Claire had awoken a short while ago unaware that her other self had already targeted another woman much like it had with her instead the pony-tailed young woman solely focused on the fact that she had indeed outgrown her previous record-breaking size now a mount of blubber overshadowing the nearby buildings!

She sighed and groaned from time to time her enormous cheeks and vast amount of chins swaying as did the massive folds of fat belonging to her gigantic blob-like body rippled like waves in the ocean.

Her eyesight still a bit hazy the brunette attempted to gather herself in any way she could. Burping slightly she could hardly believed that bitch and her blobs had made her even bigger then before.

"So much for being your little sister anymore, Chris."

She chuckled at her poor attempt at humor simply trying to find something to keep her sane and ignore the sensation of how her enormous butt cheeks had flatten many a automobile, her creamy blubber pressing and leaking into the neighboring buildings, and breasts...well guess having the world's largest chest was amazing if she wasn't a literal blob of a woman at the moment.

Still there had to be something she could do despite her immense girth, that creature that had done this to her was still out there and it had to be stopped...somehow? But how?

There was also the fact that she could feel her dome of a belly groaning and churning, Claire fearing for a moment that she was already creating another evil copy.

"Can't let...that happen."

She grumbled as her stomach quaked and shook like no tomorrow.

"Have to stay strong...I'm a Redfield dammit!"

Claire yelled motivating herself as best she could, her cheeks inflating in size as she felt something coming forth.
1321111221121111111.title: Meanwhile back with Claire...

choices: The left door...finding the map! Good work!
The right door...coming face to face with herself...
132111122112112.content:
Only minutes after Claire had passed out from the invasive introductions of the new set of blobs did they finally get to work. The process of making more Claire copies had been cut from hours to minutes as the blobs worked together to record and imitate Claire's exact looks, personality, and genetic makeup before conglomerating back outside.

The blobs hadn't even bothered to wake their gargantuan host, whose weight lay somewhere in the thousands of pounds currently, before forcing her body to regurgitate themselves, having more than enough control over Claire's body to serve their purposes.

First it was one, then another, and another blob that Claire coughed up until finally 10 fully fledged copies of Claire Redfield stood gathered outside the now significantly smaller original body.

"So, what is the plan from here?" One of them asked casually, whilst stretching to test the confines of their new form.

"Simple, we scout out the city as 'Claire' and then add whomever we find to our little...breeding circle." Another replied while pointing back at the real Claire, who was still too exhausted to even fathom waking up.

"What about the original?" Another inquired, "The amount of copies we've made has brought her down to about 250 pounds, giving her back her mobility, and once she wakes up she will no doubt try to stop us..."

"Hah! The original?" A fourth scoffed arrogantly, flicking its 'hair' back listlessly, "She could not handle even one of us even at her optimal weight, much less in her newly engorged form. She's no threat."

"Yet types like her do have a knack for the unthinkable..." Yet another clone pointed out. "I say we still proceed with caution."

"Indeed," the sixth Claire chirped, before placing a finger to her chin in thought, "in that case, we all split up and patrol the city, and if she just so happens to stumble upon us and is acting against us, we assimilate ourselves back into her body and...assume direct control from there.

"Agreed." All the Claires nodded in unison as they all went their separate ways to go find more unwitting citizens of the city to add to their ranks, leaving the unconscious Claire to continue her slumber.

Later...

"Ohhh...URRRP..." Claire awoke with a groan, a belch following soon after as she felt a major pain in her stomach flair up as she awoke from unconsciousness. "What happened?"

Looking around, she saw no signs of the blob, but was surprised to find herself a whole lote skinnier than before, and while she was still very much a portly Claire, she found she could at least move and probably even walk around in this state, much to her relief.

"Also pretty surprising that my vest held up..." she muttered while looking down at her chest. The garment was definitely put through its paces, and had the rips and tears to show for it, but sure enough the trusty item of cloth was still loyally protecting the modesty of her breasts even when her undershirt and bra had long since tapped out.

"Can't really say the same for my shorts though..." Claire sighed as she found that a very strained pair of panties was all that was protecting her bottom half from indecency. However, it suddenly dawned on Claire with no short amount of terror as to why she had shed so many pounds in such a short time.

"No..." She whispered, "no no no! They made more of me!"

With the horrid revelation realized, Claire knew she had to somehow find a way to stop the evil versions of herself before they found someone else to fatten up and clone.

"Gotta...get...urgh...up!" Claire grunted, before heaving herself up off the ground, making her wince as her entire body jiggled, though it was mitigated by the sole fact that she could even get up now.

Noting the trail of slime left on nearby walls and buildings, Claire took a deep breath and set off down one of the streets with a determined waddle.

Figuring that the best way to warn the citizens of the threat would be through the nearby police station, Claire wandered around aimlessly, trying to find a good landmark before she paused to take a breather.

"Huff...huff...all of...this...huff...stupid weight!" She growled, glaring down at her fattened form. "Can't even...hooo...walk fifty feet...urgh...without getting winded!"

After a few minutes of catching her breath, Claire once again continued her journey. However, before she got too far, felt an all too familiar trembling sensation in her gut, much to her chagrin.

"Oh please no..." Claire pleaded, "there can't possibly be anymore of those blobs still in me right?" Claire knew she was wrong as she felt the trembling get stronger and stronger as seconds passed. Yet, as the trembling sensation grew stronger, and Claire could even see her gut shifting and churning, she didn't even feel like throwing up or coughing a blob up like she did before.

"Huh...weird..." Claire muttered, placing a hand on her belly as the churning intensified to try and calm it, "maybe it-"

"Hello?" A voice called out, making Claire freeze in her tracks as she heard her own voice call out from nearby. "Hello is anybody out there? My name is Claire! I could sure use some help!"

Claire anxiously looked around for a place to hide while trying to pacify her growling tummy, finally choosing to hide behind a stack of crates nearby as she heard footsteps approaching.

She had only just sat down when she heard the voice ring out not 5 feet from behind the other side of her hiding place.

"Could've sworn I heard something..." She heard the doppelganger grumble in frustration. As Claire held her breath in fear, her stomach's groans and churning got ever louder and stronger as she even felt like her stomach was pulling her towards the fake Claire.

Come on come on... Claire screamed in her mind, just leave already so this stupid gut can shut up! Luckily, it seems that the clone hadn't heard anything as Claire heard a frustrated sigh emit, and footsteps getting softer and softer as they headed away.

"Oh thank god..." Claire sighed as she finally let her breath out. "Huh...my stomach is starting to clear up too..." she noted as she felt the groans and gurgles start to get weaker and weaker as time progressed.

Maybe it only acts up in their vicinity? Claire thought, wondering if she could use her stomach as some kind of radar to let her know when the doppelgangers were close. Shrugging the thought off, Claire hoisted herself up, dusted herself off, and resumed her search for the police station.

Figuring that a nearby store would at least have a map of the city, Claire waddlef into a nearby convenience store and saw two doors leading into the back. However, once again she felt the familiar trembling in her gut, making her gulp nervously.

"Well..." she whispered, "hope I don't pick the wrong one..." Sighing, and giving her belly a pat for good luck, Claire made her way towards...
132111122112112.title: The blobs finish with Claire, and make more of ...

choices: Claire manages to shake control long enough for the doppelganger to freeze...
Claire's will falters, and she loses control, setting the other Claire Free...
1321111221121121.content:
Claire stopped before the left door in the hallway. Her stomach churned violently, which brought her feelings of unease to an all time high. She knew that by this point, it would likely be best for her to turn tail and run away. However, she also knew that if she ran away now and ended up abandoning the chances of finding a map of the area, then wandering around aimlessly without a destination would yield more of a chance of running into those blobs again, and somehow she knew that if they found her wandering around...well they might not be so keen on leaving her mobile or even alive if they found her again.

After pausing for a few more moments Claire cautiously cracked open the door just enough for her to at least see some of the room. It was a standard, if not compact office that the owners of the store most likely used for paperwork and after hour accounting. Claire could see that there was really only a desk, a chair, and a filing cabinet, with no signs or noises to indicate that anything else was in the room. What made her anxious about entering however, was the fact that the light had been left on. So either the owners had forgotten to hit the lights on the way out...or something else had turned them on.

"Well," Claire muttered, "here goes nothing..." As she slowly pushed the door open wider, she took a cautious glance around the room, and much to her relief, there was nothing lying in wait for her, though she didn't completely relax since the churning in her stomach hadn't lessened any since entering the room. Choosing to ignore the rumblings of her stomach, she quickly scanned the room to see if their was anything of use.

"Bingo!" Claire exclaimed, her eyes locked on to a map of Raccoon City, and while the map itself was frayed lightly at the edges and some of the routes had obviously been worn away, Claire could still at least find her way around the city a lot easier now that she had a sense of direction to go towards. With a quick nod of approval, she folded the map up and tucked it away. After searching around for anything else in the area, Claire decided that nothing else there remained of use.

Heading back into the main lobby Claire looked around to see if there was anything else that she could use in the store. Money would likely be of no use to her seeing as how the city itself seemed to be in disarray, and that carrying cash around would likely give her position away if any change was involved.

Maybe some food? She thought to herself, before looking down at the rest of her figure in disgust before muttering, "nah, with this much weight on me I better not..." Looking around once more, she spotted what looked to be a crowbar, still surprisingly usable. "This may be cliche," she noted bemusedly, her hands weighing the feel of the solid chunk of metal in her hands, "but this could definitely be a good thing to keep around!" Giving it a few test swings, she smiled. While it may not have been the ideal weapon, in the right hands it could definitely get her out of a tight spot. Unfortunately, as Claire swung her makeshift weapon around, she misjudged the trajectory on one of swing, and ended up knocking over some of the products on the shelves.

BANG! Claire reeled back from the force of her crowbar meeting the shelf, the display emitting a loud noise as the contact left a sizable dent in the wood. However, the damage wasn't what worried Claire the most as she froze.

Her stomach began to churn wildly as Claire heard a door open down the hallway and footsteps moving towards her location at a frenzied pace. Claire looked around in fear, wondering if their was anywhere to go. Her eyes caught the door to what looked like a walk-in freezer that had a locking mechanism on it.

Claire had just started to make her way towards it when she saw someone emerge from the hallway she was in.

"Huh!" The clone Claire exclaimed, "well if isn't the original tubby Claire! I didn't think you'd be up and about so soon!"

Claire grimaced, knowing that if she didn't figure something out fast she probably would be forced to ingest the blob again, or worse.

"Aw come on!" The doppelganger giggled sweetly, "you don't have to look that unhappy to see me! Besides, you might as well savor the last bits of conversation of your life as much as possible right?"

"As if I'd let you get near me!" Claire grunted, tensing as she sensed a fight approaching.

"Heh, I thought that would be the case." Other Claire scoffed, rolling her eyes, "that's why the others and I agreed to make sure to tie up this loose end if you ever showed up."

It was then that Claire noticed something about the other Claire, while she definitely had the figure and body shape of her old weight, she was also a bit more...transparent, as if she was not yet complete, which wouldn't make sense unless...

Claire turned to her left just in time to catch a smaller blob leaping towards her, and on pure reflex and adrenaline she swung the crowbar, knocking the blob away from her and into the wall. Claire heard another rustling directly behind her and while she was a bit slower, she managed to spin around and swing the crowbar just fast enough to catch a second blob attempting to ambush her and meeting the same fate as it was launched into the other wall with a resounding splat!

Claire, turning back to her main threat, looked just in time to see the other Claire running towards her. Claire tried to duck, but ended up tripping over her own feet as her momentum threw her off balance. Luckily, this managed to work in her favor as she heard a rush of wind sail over her head as she heard the other Claire land behind her.

Claire got up hurriedly, her mind working at a furious pace to figure out what she could do to get away when her eyes landed on the freezer door. Claire thought for a moment before realizing that with her current weight even if she made it outside the store she wouldn't be able to stay ahead of the blobs for even a moment, and so she bolted as fast as she could towards the freezer door, grunting in disapproval as she felt her belly, breasts, and thighs jiggle vigorously as she moved.

Luckily, as she entered the freezer, Claire saw that the lights were off, which would work to her advantage. Slamming the door shut, she hid behind a nearby stack of frozen goods which was fortunately big enough to conceal her presence and quite near to the door. Hearing the door ripped open, and seeing light emit from the doorway which housed her own silhouette. Claire waited for a moment before grabbing a nearby box of off-brand frozen yogurt and chunked the box further into the freezer, away from the doorway.

Claire smirks as the box clatters to the floor and she hears a 'gotcha' from the doorway. Hearing the doppelganger leap towards the back of the freezer Claire got up and rushed out of the room, slamming the door shut behind her and bolting the lock on the door.

"Heh, nice one..." she hears from the other side of the door, "but aren't you forgetting two very important things?" Claire looked up in fear as she saw the two blobs rushing her. Unfortunately, the earlier fight, short as it was, left Claire much more fatigued than she thought, and she was immediately pinned down by the two gelatinous foes. Claire could only attempt to yell out as they once again entered her mouth, each one working their way into her body as Claire felt her belly inflating more and more by the second, with the rest of her body slowly following suite as the slimy intruders rapidly digested themselves and placed the newly formed fat all throughout her body.

Claire groaned, leaning back against the freezer door as she felt too exhausted to move. Luckily, since the blobs had been smaller, Claire hadn't gained as much as she thought, but if her engorged gut, and larger breasts were anything to go by, she still felt a whole lot heavier.

"Crap..." Claire groaned, before attempting to get up from her sitting position.

"Not so fast!" the other Claire called from beyond the door, making Claire freeze in place. "Be a dear and unlock the door for me please would you?"

"Huff...As if!" Claire hissed at her, before slowly standing up and stumbling towards the door, or rather, she would have, if her body had moved any. "W-What the hell?!?" Claire grunted frustratedly, trying to move her limbs, but try as she might her body would not obey her commands. "Oh no..." Claire gulped as she realized in terror what had happened. The other Claire had played its moves perfectly, and despite Claire's evasion of her doppelganger's traps, the other Claire had known that even one blob meant that Claire's chances of survival were significantly reduced, as ingesting the blobs would let the other Claire gain control of her body.

"Claire!" Her doppelganger sung, "I'm waitiiiiiing..." as if the words issued some unspoken command, Claire suddenly felt her legs turn around and her arm begin to stretch out against her will. Claire tried to do something anything, but the most she could manage was a shuddering stifle of her arm's movement.

"No..." Claire growled as she tried to wrest control of her body back, "I won't...let. You. Win!"

"Huh, you're actually managing to fight back?" The other Claire called out with a hint of amazement lacing its tone, "you must either be really stubborn or actually strong-willed, but I'm afraid it ends here." Suddenly, Claire gasped as her arm once again extended much quicker, grasping the lock of the door before she could react.

NO! Claire screamed internally, I have to keep fighting! Claire knew it was over if she faltered for even a moment, and managed through using all of her willpower, to keep her hand rooted in place, the appendage simply grasping the lock, but not turning it. Claire remained locked in the stalemate, neither side yielding until finally...
1321111221121121.title: Mapping out a Strategy

choices: She catches sight of another Claire...
She gets to the Police Station unharmed...
13211112211211211.content:
To say that today had not been Claire's day had been an understatement.

First, she'd come to this godforsaken city looking for even a trace of her brother's whereabouts. Then, after finding out absolutely nothing on that end, she'd been stuffed silly by slimy balls of goo that fattened her into immobility, and then finally, after somehow waking up and thinking life had finally cut her some slack by letting her shrink down so she could move around, it turns out that they can make evil clones of her that can control the blobs. Oh, and said blobs can control her body if they get inside her!

So yeah, I'd file this under 'worst roadtrip I've ever taken.' Claire snidely thought as she fought desperately to maintain as much control of her limbs, which were poised to unlock the door and let her copycat out, an outcome which would most certainly spell her doom. However, she knew it was a losing battle, she could feel her muscles burning from exertion, beads of sweat forming and running in thin rivulets down her face as she grit her teeth and stood her ground against the influence of the blobs.

"Claaaaaaire~" she heard the mimic sing from the other side of the door, "please open the door, it's getting a bit chilly in here, wouldn't want me to freeze to death? Would you?" The other Claire's went from fake sweetness to a firm command as she finished her sentence, and the second she did, Claire felt her hands surge forward and grasp the lock as control was wrested from her.

"NO!" Claire yelped, caught off guard by the sudden movement, her quick reflexes and reaction time being the only thing that saved her as she put everything she had into making sure she didn't undo the lock to the door.

"Claire, cut the crap!" She heard a bark from the other side as her twin raised her voice, a hint of anger now laced in, "your pitiful resistance was amusing at first but now it's growing tiresome! Open. This. Door! Once again Claire felt an external force trying to make her body act against her will, however, this time Claire was ready, as she steeled herself and pushed back against the attack.

"How...about -huff huff- no?" Claire panted, pouring sweat as she continued defending against the internal onslaught, "there's...no way...in hell I'm letting you out!"

"CLAIRE REDFIELD!" She heard a roar emit from the other side, a furious set of loud pounds on the doorway following the furious cry from her doppelganger. "YOU OPEN THE D-DOOR T-THIS I-INSTANT OR I'LL-"

"What, freeze to death?" Claire finished with a knowing grin, though her twin couldn't see it. "You sounded a bit cold at the end there?"

"YOU DARE MOCK ME?!?" 'Claire' shrieked, slamming her fists against the door even harder as chunks of her fists turned into blobs and splintered off, showing that her body temperature was dropping, and fast.

Claire smiled, she could hear desperation building in the fake's voice, and with every assault she laid onto the door, the less she force she poured into controlling Claire, who was able to finally start drawing her hands away from the lock. So that means with one solid push... Claire thought, bracing herself.The moment she felt a drop in the stalemate, she clenched her jaw tight and pulled herself back.

With a triumphant yell she flopped onto her back, her body jiggling as the layers of fat felt the force from her collision with the floor. Huffing and puffing after emerging victorious in the battle of wills, Claire grinned wearily up at the door.

"And That's...hoo...why you...don't mess...with a Redfield..." Claire chuckled, pushing herself upright with her elbows back into a sitting position. Looking down at herself, she gave her arms and legs a few experimental flexes and and stretches to make sure she wasn't under any other blob based influences. Confirming that she was back in control of her body, she shakily rose to her feet and unlocked the door, peeking inside the freezer to find that the fake Claire had frozen solid.

"Wow...uh...that was quicker than I expected." Claire said, scratching the back of her head in surprise before the chill of the freezer met the skin of her bare belly, causing her to shiver. "Brrrrr- just how cold is this thing?" Looking at the temperature gauge on the inside wall, she noticed it measured 0 degrees Celsius. Way colder than normal, but it worked out. She shrugged and retrieved the crowbar she had previously dropped in the chaos. Grabbing the tool off the ground, she turned to the frozen Claire in the doorway and wound up a swing.

With a resounding crack, the icy countenance shattered into pieces as the metal tool made contact with Claire's foe. Immediately she noticed the pieces of her doppelganger shift back into a shapeless mass inside their prison of ice with no guiding intelligence to keep them together. Her victory now assured, Claire wiped her forehead with her arm to mop up her sweat, and closed the door to the freezer.

"Finally...it's over..." Claire sighed to herself in relief. Taking a moment to survey the area, it seemed that the coast was clear. Sitting back down, she took a moment to catch her breath and review herself situation while taking a look at the map she had procured. "Alright...So I'm over here at this convenience store..." she pointed at her current location, "so it seems like the Police Station is a bit further up ahead. Hopefully I don't run into any more me's on the way..."

And also..I could do without the extra weight those blobs gave me, she thought, shooting a grimace down as she silently wished she was able to get the blobs out of her. Just as the thought crossed her mind however, she felt a strange churning in her gut, and she placed a hand on her ballooned belly as it seemed to squirm underneath her touch. "What the -mmph!" She muttered before slamming her mouth shut as her stomach rumbled and she felt a familiar gooey substance shoot back up her throat. "Agh! What the hell? Mmph!" She blanched as she spit up the two smaller blobs from earlier, the masses now laying on the floor with the occasional quiver. "Okay...okay I guess that worked out..." she breathed, feeling a bit nauseous after practically vomiting out the two blobs. Fearfully, Claire tensed as she took a tentative step towards the blobs, waiting for the moment they would leap or dart towards her.

"Alright...I'm just gonna go over...here..." Claire awkwardly stuttered, before slowly walking past the two. Turning her head as she passed, she noticed that the blobs didn't seem to acknowledge her presence, and if she didn't see them occasionally twitch, she'd have thought they were dead. Huh...I guess leaving them there is alright? Claire decided, before the blobs suddenly darted a few inches to the right, making her squeak in surprise. "Um...well then I guess they wanted to move right-" the blobs darted right once again as she said the word 'right,' making her pause as she noticed the slight trend.

Let's test this...left? She thought hesitantly, and sure enough, the moment she thought the word 'left,' the blobs started slowly moving to the left. "No way..." she breathed, "can I actually...control them?" Figuring a few more tests were in order, she mentally ordered the blobs to move left, right, towards her, and away from her, and sure enough, every time she issued a command either out loud or with her thoughts, the blobs followed the order without delay.

"Huh...weird...I guess that must've happened when I beat that other me before after breaking free of her control? ,,,Doesn't matter I guess." Claire shook her head in dismissal, "is there anything else I can- woah!" Claire stumbled back, startled as her vision changed from looking at the blobs to seeing herself towering over her a few feet away. Fearfully lifting a hand to her face, she was surprised to see that through the weird point of view she saw the view of herself raise that same hand. Willing one of the blobs to head towards her, she jumped as she saw herself take up more of her vision as her view rocked slightly, as if scooting closer. "I guess I can see through you guys too then? Neat!" Claire chirped, seeing herself smile through the blob's vision. "Can I get back to normal- ah there we go!" She nodded as her vision turned back to her point of view. "This should come in handy if the other versions of me can't control you all."

After figuring out her handy new ability to herd the blobs, she looked back towards the freezer and opened the door. I wonder... she thought pensively, before ordering the blob remnants that were once her doppelganger to vibrate in order to melt the ice they were trapped in. Surprisingly, the command was carried out as the ice melted off the blob remnants and the parts reformed into one bigger pile of goop.

"I'd say it's best not to reveal this ability until I need it," Claire spoke thoughtfully to her entourage, "don't want those fakes to get wind of this new advantage until absolutely necessary...so in that case..." Claire took a breath before commanding all three blobs to head back towards her. Almost eagerly the blobs crawled towards her and made their way up towards her mouth.

"Hey! Easy eas- mmph!" Claire was cut off as the blobs entered her mouth, pushing her back down as she shuddered in discomfort from the feeling of each blob sliding down her throat, expanding her belly and piling on the pound as she passed her previous weight of 250 pounds and ended somewhere around 280 pounds due to the extra passenger. "Oh..." she groaned, rubbing her bigger belly in slight annoyance feeling the blobs within her squirm at her touch. "I was gonna say not everyone at once..." With a sigh, she got to her feet and headed out of the store, her destination clear.

Along the way...
13211112211211211.title: An Iron Fortitude and New Abilities...

choices: It was another one of those monsters, but in an officer's clothes!
The door had slammed open to reveal a sickly green blob form...
132111122112112112.content:
Something's not right here... Claire thought to herself as she slowly made her way through the back alleys of the city. Taking a glance around, everything seemed normal enough, at least for a deserted alleyway. Nothing except a few pieces of discarded paper, bottles, and other litter sparsely populating the ground. However, in the distance she could hear the faint wails of what sounded like a chorus of car alarms all going off at once.

"The hell?" The flabby female grunted as she moved herself a bit faster, trying to ignore the sensation of her fatter frame erupting into a cascade of jiggles, and the light squirming of the cargo stored of her rounded gut. "Could've sworn I heard something-" Claire froze as she heard a loud crash from the end of the corridor, subconsciously drawing the crowbar she'd acquired earlier just in case she needed to defend herself from any potential assailant. Taking a deep breath to calm herself, she silently made her way to the end of the alleyway and was about to take a peek, when she heard another sound.

"Ghuuuuhg..." Claire felt her breath hitch for half a second as she heard a groan from around the corner that sound vaguely human-like. However, the sound that was let out gave the impression as though whatever had made it was either very exhausted, or in a mind numbing amount of pain, as though the source was almost half dead. Claire cautiously poked her head out from the corner, and nearly vomited at the sight that greeted her.

What had made the sound it seems, was humanoid enough, as the entity, or rather a group of entities bore the shapes and statures of average men and women. That was where the similarities ended however, as the gnarled gray hue of their cracked and mottled skin, and the blank white eyes, devoid of life, told the Redfield sister that if these things had once been human, they certainly weren't anymore. Added to that fact was that the group of things seemed to be readily engrossed in consuming someone's corpse.

Oh god... Claire blanched, feeling bile rise up in her throat as the horrid stench of death and decay met her nostrils, I have to get out of here, but this seems to be the only way to the police station...and I don't really feel backtracking would be the best option. Suddenly, a familiar slithering sound caught her attention as the passengers in her stomach began to squirm more intensely. "Oh not again..." Claire gulped as she wildly looked around for the blobs she knew were in hiding somewhere.

In a stroke of luck however, she seemed to not be the main target of the blobs for once as the insidious piles of goop leapt down from the rooftops and landed in front of the creatures, giving pause to their feast and meeting the newcomers with a few moans as they began to shamble towards their new targets. What surprised Claire however, was that immediately the blobs moved and knocked down each of the monsters with inhuman efficiency, engulfing their bodies as they set to work. Claire's jaw dropped as she saw the bodies of the once-human abominations melting and dissolving into the masses of goo, which began to grow steadily larger as they added more mass to their forms.

Once they had completed this process however, the woman watched as all of the blobs moved slower, and eventually went motionless while turning a sickly green hue. Claire wondered what could possibly have happened to the blobs, as they made no sign of wanting to go anywhere else.

After waiting a few minutes to see what they did, Claire shrugged and crept behind them, making sure to not kick any of the stray cans or other potential noise sources as she approached an abandoned bus that had crashed through a fence separating her from the next part of the street. Upon reaching the closed doors of the bus, she looked back once more to make sure none of the blobs had made an effort to follow her, sighing in relief once she'd confirmed them to be in the exact same spots as before.

Alrighty, now to pry this bad boy open! The younger Redfield thought as she took her crowbar in hand and plunged it through the gap between the doors. With a few heavy tugs, they swung open, Claire proudly flexing an arm and giving it a prideful pat. Heh, even if I am a complete butterball now, I still pack a punch when I need to!

After the momentary celebration, she resumed her quest and boarded the bus. Unfortunately nothing seemed to be of use except for a few scattered bills laying around and some strewn suitcases and bags. She pocketed a bit of money and took a suitcase since she needed a change of clothes anyways, though she doubted that the money would be usable with the city in the ruined state it seemed to be in.
