The suitcase, she found upon opening up, was a bit more of an immediate help, as she found a black t-shirt and a pair of gray sweatpants that were practically in mint condition.

"Well...at least now I won't be walking around practically naked anymore..." Claire snorted as she slipped the t-shirt on easily enough under her tattered red jacket. The sweatpants gave her a bit more trouble, but after popping a few seems the stretchy material managed to fit her thick thighs and bigger butt quite well.

After taking a moment to make sure everything was on straight, Claire decided her belly would just have to hang out like it was, huffing in annoyance as she exited the bus through the doors at the rear end.

"Here I thought only pregnant women had to deal with their gut hanging out like this..." Claire groaned, the slimy occupants of said tummy squirming outwards as if to make a point, "oh don't give me that! I'm not you guys' mom." She rolled her eyes as she realized the absurdity of her situation, "besides, I don't think the doctors would believe me being preggers with a couple of slime babies."

After a few more minutes of the slow walk she was doing, and a number of pokes to her belly in a futile attempt to quite her allies, she had finally reached her destination.

"The Raccoon City Police Department..." She whispered to herself, "I hope there's someone here who knows what the hell is going on..." The building looked like it had seen better days, with most of the brickwork looking worn and weathered by time, however, the sturdy set of wooden double doors conveyed that at least some, if not all, of the place had been well kept. At least, until recent events had transpired. Grunting as she shoved a door open, Claire jumped as the door slammed shut behind her.

Seeing no reason to go back outside, she took a look around and saw that she had entered into what looked to be the Main Hall of the station, a few doors on either side of her. What seemed to be a visitor's desk was set up in the middle of the hall, with a peculiar looking statue that carried the image of a Unicorn a small distance behind that. With nothing and no one else in the room with her, Claire found it best to check the visitor's desk out first.

At first, she had been happy to find that a phone lay on the desk, but her joy was quickly silenced as she found that the phone was unable to make any calls out, only met with static at each attempt. The other two items, she found, weren't much better, as she acquired a box of rounds that looked perfect for a handgun, if she had one, and a set of ink ribbons that were presumably used for the typewriter that lay on the other half of the desk in front of her.

Seeing no harm in taking a break, Claire chuckled and figured she might as well use the typewriter to note down her experiences in the city so far. Not like anyone will read it, but hey, it's been a hell of a day...

After typing out her story thus far, Claire stood up and pocketed the box of handgun cartridges. She figured it would be best to keep them around in case she actually did manage to find a proper home for them.

Turning around to view each of the doors to the station she narrowed down her choice of available options to one door, as the other two seemed to be locked by a security mechanism that needed the swipe or scan of a keycard. Sighing, Claire made her way through the door of the section labeled "West Office."

Once she made it inside, she looked around, frowning at the haphazard state of the room as many books, documents, cups, and other articles were strewn about the tables and floor the room possessed. A sudden sound caught her attention as she tensed up, looking around and finding that...
132111122112112112.title: A Brief Respite

choices: Yes she is! The blobs are depositing their increased mass in Claire's body!
Nope... She's possibly hallucinating, due to what's going on around her.
Actually, something else happened instead...
1321111221121121121.content:
Once she made it inside, she looked around, frowning at the haphazard state of the room as many books, documents, cups, and other articles were strewn about the tables and floor the room possessed. A sudden sound caught her attention as she tensed up, looking around and finding that...

It was another one of those monsters, but in an officer's uniform!

It slowly limped and lumbered it's way toward the chubbier Claire, arms stretched towards her with a dead look in it's eyes as it moaned, "Guuuuuuuhhhgg..."

Readily arming herself with a nearby wooden chair, Claire prepared to strike down the dead-looking monstrosity before her. However, the blobs that reside with her taut stomach had other plans, as her belly burgled profusely.

"No! Not now..." Claire muttered, just as she involuntarily regurgitated the four basketball-sized blobs from her systems. From there, the four blobs surprisingly lunged at the undead creature, smothering it in their mucus-coated gelatinous forms, devouring it in a corrosive manner.

A few moments later, the only things that remained of what Claire could only presume was once human were nothing but tattered dissolved remains of a police uniform. Claire noticed that the four blobs that "rescued" her from the monster looked noticeably bigger in size and mass.

"Is it just me, or are those blobs...bigger?" Claire thought to herself, but despite the rescue, the four blobs then promptly returned to their "mother's" womb, but not before Claire pleaded, "No, please wait-! *GLUP!!*"

And just like so, the blobs began to forcefully insert themselves back down into Claire's gullet and stomach, causing her already plump stomach to bloat out even more than before.

Of course, this sudden surge of increased weight took a hit on her center of gravity, as she stumbled back onto a nearby wooden bench, clenching her now larger stomach in major discomfort. "

"Ugh!! You could've at least give me a minute before you--" Claire exclaimed, only to stop mid-sentence when she suddenly began to feel something..."peculiarly hefty" regarding her body.

"...Is...I-Is it just me, or am I getting fatter?" Claire thought, as she noticed that her already plump physique looked to be increasing in girth and bulk...but is it, though?
1321111221121121121.title: Blobbish Reinforcements

choices: Decided to Fight All Three Zombies Alone!
Open Her Mouth, letting the blobs take the two behind her.
13211112211211211211.content:
Unfortunately for Claire, her current assumption proved absolutely correct, as she began to witness her boobs press tighter against her shirt, while she felt a wave of fat encompass her legs and butt, making the already tight feeling sweatpants that covered her butt feel almost suffocating.

"Craaaaap..." she moaned in discomfort, standing up as best as she could. "I-URP better get to a mirror quick..." she declared sickly, letting out a belch that signaled a bout of indigestion. Justifiable, considering the blobs' 'meal' was pretty much rotting meat. Huffing as she slowly waddled, "great, can't even walk normally now," she sighed as she spotted a full body mirror on the other side of the room.

Surprisingly, she didn't grew as much as she thought she did. As opposed to the fifty pound minimum that each previous weight gain had added she seemed to have only gained fifteen or so pounds. So while it was still a noticeable gain, with her bust, rear, and face all developing another half inch or so of fat, it wasn't something that would render her immobile.

"Well, I can still move around, so that's something at least..." Claire grimaced, turning around to inspect the rest of her frame. "You four cannot jump the gun like that again though! Anymore stunts like that and we might really be stuck if I pack on too many pounds!" Her belly churned and gurgled in what she hoped was an affirmative, before she got fed up and decided to inspect what was left of her adversary.

Lowering herself onto her knees, Claire peered over her belly and rifled through the slime-ridden garments, which luckily no longer posed any threat to her well being as she felt no sting or stab that would signal the dissolving of her skin. Reaching into the pockets of the shirt and pants, she managed to recover a relatively intact letter, and a Blue Keycard from the back pocket of the work pants.

"That should come in handy for those doors outside if I'm right...now let's see about this letter..." Unfurling the wrinkled piece of parchment, she quickly read through the contents. She discovered that the monster had once been a part of the Raccoon City Police Department named Marvin Branagh, who had been helping people in the city evacuate after the start of some massive outbreak that was caused by some unknown source that rendered the corpses of the dead able to move around and turn other people into one of them. From the later half of the letter, Branagh believed himself to be beyond help, and had been knocked unconscious before waking up to one of his rookie officers who went by the name of "Leon S. Kennedy."

Furthermore, the officer, believing himself to be fatally wounded, sent the other away to escape without him, before Branagh began to mutate. The final words were illegible, devolving from a jumble of words to random scrawls of ink.

"Must've found him not too long after he turned..." Claire surmised, frowning as she was hit with a wave of sorrow at the man's untimely end, "but these things, are they zombies or something? They seem to fit the bill at least..." She shook her head, heaving herself up to the ground and leaning back against the table as she pondered what to do next. "Well...if this 'Leon' guy is still around, maybe I have chance of running into him and teaming up...after all, between these zombies and blob creatures, I'll need all the help I can get."

Figuring that was her best bet, Claire dusted herself off and made her way back into the Main Hall. Upon exiting the West Office, she heard a click, and looked back.

"The hell?" She muttered, before jiggling the door handle, realizing that it no longer gave way, but remained firmly in place, "guess I'm not going back in there anytime soon..." Shaking her head, she walked back over to the visitor's desk, noticing a place to swipe the keycard she'd obtained. After doing so, she heard the sound of an affirmative 'beep' from both sides of her, and the clicks of two tumblers unlocking soon after. "Guess that did it!" Claire cheered, pumping her fist victoriously.

Deciding to try the right side of the floor after trying one on the left already, she wandered inside the section labeled "Reception Desk."

Unfortunately, as soon as she entered, she heard the familiar moan of what she now knew to be zombies, the smell giving them away only slightly after the sound. Sighing as she pulled her crowbar out for action, and her survival knife from her shoulder holster in her off hand, she turned the corner and saw two zombies. As luck would have it though, the two seemed to be unaware of her presence as they simply stared blankly at the wall in front of them, engrossed in whatever the undead might think about.

This should be simple enough! Claire smirked, preparing to creep up and dispose of the two as silently as she could.

"Graaaaagh!" A moan directly in her ear made her shriek as she spun around, nearly falling over from her own momentum as she realized that she'd failed to spot a third zombie hiding in the other corner from the side she'd entered. Catching her off guard, the zombie pinned her to the ground on her back, eagerly opening its maw in an attempt to chomp down on her flab ridden flesh. Unfortunately for this zombie, Claire Redfield was far from a helpless damsel in distress.

"GET. The HELL. Off ME!" Claire cried out, punctuating each cry with a gloved punch or a kick to the zombie's body. With one final well placed shove from both feet, she threw her assailant away from her, quickly sitting up and recovering her crowbar and knife after having dropped them in the previous ambush.

"Gruuuuughhh! Graaaarrrg!" A pair of moans from behind her made her pale as she swiveled her head around only to confirm her fear that the other two zombies had been alerted to her intrusion, coming to help their undead comrade in arms.

Urrrrgh...this isn't good... Claire thought nervously, as slow as these guys are they have me on both sides, and if I get bit by them... the woman gulped. She had no desire to join the city wide body count.

As if picking the perfect opportunity to remind her of their use, the blobs within her squirmed heavily as her belly rocked back and forth, nearly knocking her off balance. Much as I'd hate to, I might have to use them again...but how much would I gain? Claire grit her teeth. Either she took them on alone and risked getting herself injured or worse, or she used her commanding nature of the blobs and payed the price in literal pounds.

After a second or two, Claire sighed and shifted her body, deciding to...
13211112211211211211.title: Protection Comes with a Weighty Price!

choices: No. The blobs are giving her increased strength to compensate for her weight.
Yeah, she's probably imagining that she's a little stronger.
Actually, something else happened instead...
132111122112112112112.content:
It felt as if time itself had slowed down to a crawl for Claire, hastily try to come up with a solution to her current situation, which involved her about to be swarmed by three shambling zombies.

"*sigh* ...It looks like I've got to use my new slimy friends here...I just hope this doesn't result in me getting too fat to even run." Claire muttered, instinctively opening her mouth wide enough for the four blobs to promptly launch out of her mouth to protect their chubby matriarch.

Suffice to say, this was something would have to get accustomed to, should she not a firearm soon.

From there, as if they had a hive mind, the first two blobs lunged at the first zombie on Claire's left, where the third blob proceeded to assault the second zombie opposite of Claire, while the fourth blob attacked the third zombie toward Claire's right.

Claire noticed that the four blobs were back to their original sizes prior to consuming anything, which was the size of a basketball. "Huh... That's...weird It's as if those blobs are depositing their extra mass into me. But...why?" Claire pondered, as her slimy escorts voraciously devoured every scrap of rotting flesh upon each of the three zombies, leaving nothing but mucus-coated bones and tattered clothes.

Once the blobs were done, they became as large as they were previously before returning into their matriarch's stomach. Strangely enough, Claire half-expected them to eagerly return to being within her plump stomach, as Claire cocked an eyebrow in some sense of initial confusion.

It was almost as if they were asking for her permission or something.

"*sigh* Fine, get in. There better be a benefit to you guys fattening me up like a pig." Claire retorted, begrudgingly opening her mouth to allow the bloated blobs to enter her mouth in a single filed line.

Of course, once all of the slimes were now inside her stomach, she soon began to immediately feel the familiar bloating feeling from previously, as the slimes deposited their excess body mass into Claire's chubby form, thus increasing her bulk and girth by a slight margin.

If Claire had to make an estimated guess, she expected she might be nearly approaching the 300 pound Mark, as she noticed that she now bore a rather noticeable double chin. And yet, strangely enough, she didn't feel so...exhausted?

But was her mind playing tricks on her?
132111122112112112112.title: Claire's Slimy Escorts

choices: Claire uses the blobs on the two zombies before she can stop...
Claire manages to resist and takes the zombies herself...
1321111221121121121122.content:
"Strange..." Claire muttered to herself, "I definitely feel heavier, but not tired at all. Maybe I- woah!" Claire yelped as her legs wobbled beneath her, the burn from holding her fattened form up finally reminding her of its existence as she fell backwards. Luckily for her, the impact from her less than lithe frame was hardly felt as the newly added supply of fat distributed to her butt provided a more than ample cushion to land on. With a grunt, she sat back and grimaced as she felt most of her body quiver violently,

"Well...nevermind, guess I just had a quick second wind there. Hoof..." Claire sighed as she wiped away the thin sheen of sweat that had developed on her brow. Looking down at herself, she realized that only after two rooms, she was totally winded without even breaking out into a run. Claire knew this lack of stamina would do her no favors in the near future, as there were doubtlessly a vast supply of zombies still left to fight through in the rest of the police station, and if she had to resort to using her newfound slime-based troops in every single encounter...

"God...I need to find a firearm or something soon...or I won't be able to walk myself out of here..." Claire placed a hand on her protruding gut that provided most of the mass to her body at this point, feeling her backup move within, almost as if responding to her touch. She spent a few minutes like this, idly poking her stomach and sitting back in order to catch her breath before moving on. Finally, after she felt most of her strength return to her legs, Claire heaved herself onto her feet with a groan, pondering where to go next.

Well, since the door doesn't seem to be locked... Claire placed a hand on her chin thoughtfully, guess continuing this way couldn't hurt. With a shrug, Claire tentatively made her way through the door at the back of the Reception Office and carefully cracked the door open. What met her eyes was a narrow, darkened, dilapidated hallway that had most certainly seen better days some years ago. Stray sheets of paper were strewn across the floor, desks haphazardly lying in a stack probably meant to serve as some sort of makeshift barricade, and worst of all, the scent of iron and streaks of blood lining a good portion of the tiling. Claire gulped as she surveyed the area as best she could, taking in the signs of an obvious struggle that had occurred quite recently, if the bright color of the blood was anything to go by.

Not the most encouraging sight...but I guess I'll have to come through here at some point anyway... Claire steeled herself with a light smack to the face. Holding her knife in one hand at the ready, she gave the door a push, grabbing the knob and halting its momentum just before it hit the wall on the side of the hall. With the maximum amount of stealth a person of her size could muster, Claire slowly made her way towards the corner of the hall.

*Dlop*

The sound of liquid hitting the ground stopped her in her tracks. Is there a leak in the pipes or something? I didn't notice any- Looking up, Claire covered her mouth, nearly screaming as she discovered the source of the noise.

What lay perched on the ceiling was an abomination of the most grotesque manner, that Claire found a hard time stomaching the mere sight of the creature. Unlike the zombies, which had looked no different from their human counterparts except for mottled skin and rotting flesh, this monster defied the form of humanity itself. The thing seemed to possess no skin at all, the vague similarities of a human body on display, musculature and sinew exposed to the elements. Its head, somehow being overtaken by its own brain, was roughly around the same size as a person's, however, the lack of eyes and nose, in combination with a mouth that sported elongated teeth perfect for ripping meat, left no room for doubt that this thing was anything but human. Added to that, it sported a set of wickedly sharp claws that glinted in the moonlight, serving to highlight the lethal capabilities each heinous talon possessed. The only "odd" thing that Claire could truly find about the creature was its abnormally long tongue that flicked idly back and forth.

Ohmygodohmygodohmygod... Claire panicked, fighting the urge to sprint from the room right then and there, partly because she knew such a feat was nearly impossible at her current weight, and partly because for some reason, despite being directly in front of her on the ceiling, the thing hadn't made any sort of move to attack her. It's blind... Claire realized, a smile of relief adorning her face, with the way its brain grew it must have lost is ability to see! Lucky!

"Guuuraghlll..." The garbled gurgle of a zombie made her snap her focus towards the next part of the room past the ceiling crawler. Oh great... Claire thought, more company... to the Redfield sister's chagrin, it seemed that a pair of zombies had noticed her and were currently shambling their way towards her, the slow gait of an undead human sounding out as their feet scraped the ground beneath them. As soon as this occurred however, Claire saw the creature above her snap its neck in the direction of the approaching assailants. At an inhuman speed, Claire watched the creature's tongue lash out at one of the zombies, puncturing the forehead with calculated precision.

Claire watched the zombie fall over, truly dead, from the creature's lightning quick assault. Okaaay...guess it definitely isn't deaf though...good thing I didn't move or else I'd end up like that zombie. Now all I have to do is wait-

*Grrrrrglllorp*

"Oh no..." Claire squeaked, her heart racing as she realized that her stomach had picked the worst time in her life to remind her that she hadn't eaten for quite some time. Unfortunately for her, this sound was easily picked up by the creature as it turned to address its rotund intruder. Once more, its tongue shot at, aiming to bore a hole into Claire's cranium and end her life. Unlike the zombie however, Claire knew she had one option left to take. Opening her mouth in tandem with the creature's, she felt one of her blob-like bodyguard's surge forth and move to block the blow, encompassing the end of the monster's tongue as the rest of its brethren emerged.

"You guys take care of that thing!" Claire ordered, "I'll deal with the small fry!" With their objective clear, the group of blobs raced to engage the most pressing threat as a unit, swiftly tackling the Licker and unseating it from its resting place on the ceiling of the hall. With a nod of approval, Claire, now freed of a bit of weight now that her troops were out and about, jogged over to the zombie, who began the fight with a clumsy swipe of its hand, obviously trying to grab a hold of Claire so that it could take a chunk or two out of her.

"Gimme a break!" Claire scoffed, easily weaving her way out of the blow, "I coulda dodged even if i was twice as heavy!" Even though the zombie possessed no sense of pride, or even a semblance of recognition of what a taunt was, Claire liked to think that the growl and the aggressive lunge that followed was a sign her words had angered her opponent. With a cocky smirk, Claire waited for her chance, the zombie nearly falling on top of her, until finally she kicked a foot out, tripping the zombie, and in a surprisingly swift move, spun around and embedded her knife in the back of the zombie's head.

"Heh...better luck next time buddy!" Claire laughed triumphantly, placing a hand on her hip, until she realized she was showing to nobody except a dead zombie, an unholy abomination, and four or so slimes that obeyed her every command. Seeing this, she blushed and scratched the back of her head in embarrassment as she found that her vanguard had long since finished off their adversary, and looked...abnormally large for it, even larger than when they'd consumed the group of three from before, coming up to Claire's waist in height instead of ankle height as normal. And speaking of zombies, Claire noticed that while she'd surveyed the aftermath of the fight, the smallest blob of the group had already broken down the zombie she'd killed and grown accordingly.

Sighing as she knew what was coming, Claire rolled her eyes and gestured with her hand, "I'd better be able to walk after this..." she growled in annoyance, but nonetheless opened her mouth in resignation as the blobs made their way towards her, not deterred in the slightest by the exasperation their matriarch showed. One by one the slimy supporters entered Claire's maw, and bit by bit Claire grew, wincing as she felt her clothes, which had been a little baggy before, fill out more and more until she thought she might burst out of them. Her shirt was nearly skintight, wrapping around her even larger bust as though it were more or less a makeshift bra rather than a T-shirt, the garment having ridden up, leaving her entire belly exposed to the world. Her sweatpants weren't faring much better, looking like they were going to split any second, and by some miracle holding on. Added to that, Claire could feel another chin in development as her face was adorned with even more pudge.

Despite her initial disgust however, Claire felt a strange...satisfaction from the growth. Huh...that wasn't so bad...it actually felt...kinda good. Wonder if I could get any bigger? I'm only around 350 pounds so-

"Stop!" She yelled, shaking her head as she started breathing heavily, "if I get any bigger I won't be able to move! I can barely walk like this as is! Even if that did feel...fine." Claire shuddered...she couldn't possibly be becoming addicted to this weight gain could she, or was this a side effect of ingesting the blobs time and time again? As she came across the next hall and saw two more zombies...
1321111221121121121122.title: Wishful Thinking and Another Threat...

choices: The Stairs, no sense in putting off the inevitable!
The first of the two rooms left in this section of the floor.
13211112211211211211221.content:
As Claire entered the next hallway, she quickly noticed that the state of disrepair in the police station was not merely limited to the main hall, which made sense considering how quickly the rest of the city had gone downhill upon her arrival. However, despite the only source of illumination being the moonlight leaking in from the windows spread across the hall, Claire could easily see two zombies vacantly loitering further down.

Unlike the two from before, these were far enough away and engrossed in their own enigmatic actions to notice the tubby Redfield sibling. Perfect, I should be able to take them down silently if I don't make any noise. Claire thought, stealthily tiptoeing, or in reality, lumbering slowly over to get closer to the pair of undead. Just as she readied her knife, a feeling began to well up within her. It was a tiny thing at first, no more than an inkling of a thought of how hungry she was. However, the feeling began to intensify, building up more and more until she felt a predatory grin form on her face as she leered at her targets.

"Mine..." she whispered, licking her lips in anticipation as she quickly opened her maw. Before she could even contemplate her actions, the blobs within her burst out of her mouth, each one flying out of the orifice and hitting the ground in uniform fashion with a resounding *SPLAT*. This of course, finally caught the attention of the two unfortunate rotting bystanders, who slowly turned to face the source of the sudden noise. Unfortunately for them, by the time they had registered that there was something else in the room to address, the blobs had already overwhelmed their prey, slamming the two poor creatures onto their backs while they flailed their arms in a futile attempt to escape their assailants.

As this was going on, Claire eagerly stared with pleased, almost ecstatic look that would signal to anyone else that something might be amiss with her mental disposition. Breathing heavily, she watched as her brood took down and absorbed their prey with practiced ease. After no more than two minutes the blobs returned to their leader, who awaited them with an open mouth and a prideful grin adorning her face. With no further actions required, the blobs quickly made their way back inside Claire, who gulped them back down with a delighted groan.

"Oh hell yes!" She said, nearly moaning in pleasure as she felt her body begin to expand from the two fresh kills the blobs had brought her. Her belly extended a few centimeters more, quietly filling out another roll on her sides as the blobs squirmed within after distributing their acquired calories back to their ravenous caretaker. Her breasts pushed the confines of her shirt even further, an audible pop being heard as seams began to split, however the shirt held on despite the internal abuse of the garment. Claire's rear did not shy away from accepting its fair share of fat as it also sought to burst out of its coverings, a few rips on the thighs of her sweatpants as the skin of these veritable tree trunks was slightly exposed to the world.

As the growth came to a close, Claire blinked, finally regaining her train of thought as her breathing began to slow, and her heart stopped racing a million miles a minute long enough for her to realize what just happened.

"W-What the hell?" She breathed, eyes taking in her now heavier form, which was about 10 or 15 pounds heavier than before if she had to guess. Not nearly as huge a jump as her previous growth, but still... "D-Did I summon them without thinking? It's like something...took over when I wasn't paying attention..." This revelation worried Claire, as she was already wary about her severely hampered mobility as it was, but if she continued to keep summoning the blobs at this rate to solve every little problem...

"I'd better keep moving..." She decided with a shake of her head, "I'll just have to try and keep myself from using them for now." Continuing on, Claire let out a frustrated sigh as she found that her already lumbering gait was just a tad slower than before, not doing anything to assuage her fears.

Checking inside the first door she came across a room that seemed like it had been used quite recently, as a cluster of desks that looked hastily grouped together were surrounding a chalkboard at the other side of the room across from the door. Documents were scattered around the floor, as though a tornado had previously made its way through the room and thrown everything to the ground before she had arrived, while a crude sketch of what Claire assumed was the station's layout was drawn on the chalkboard itself.

Looking through most of the documents, Claire found that there wasn't much information to be had in a good number of them, either pertaining to daily affairs or a record of meetings long since passed. There were even a few laden with numerous doodles talking about another city named "RedGrave" or something, and a few supernatural incidents that had occurred there. Claire thought this one odd at first, but then re-evaluated her current situation and the events that led to it, and figured that sometimes, reality proved to be stranger than fiction.

The last document she came across however, was much more recent than the others, and held within its pages a few things that piqued Claire's interests.

The document was a report on how the Police Department planned to tackle the zombie outbreak after the initial wave of zombies had begun to spread throughout the city. What baffled Claire, was the way they handled the distribution of armaments and ammunition throughout the police force.

"The Chief just decided to throw weapons and ammo in separate random places?" She scoffed, not believing what she was reading, "that's a pretty tactically inept decision in my book. If I didn't know any better, I'd say he wanted this place to go under..." Luckily, upon reading further she discovered that a good chunk of weaponry remained in the underground weapon storage facility, but unfortunately the keycard to open said facility was currently missing as of the report's creation. "Fantastic," Claire muttered, rubbing her temple in annoyance, "I guess that's another thing to keep a lookout for, that and the fuse to get the power back on..."

The most interesting thing she found in the report, was that three victims had already fallen to the same foul beast she'd encountered only minutes before. For lack of a better name, the recorder had taken to calling this creature a "Licker" in reference to its abnormally long and razor sharp tongue. Unfortunately, besides the name, no other information on how to handle them had been recorded at that time.

"Guess I'll have to figure something out before I come face to face with another one of those..." Claire muttered, before wincing, "unless I want to get even closer to becoming a beached whale that is." Sighing, Claire closed the document, figuring that at least she found a goal to work towards if nothing else.

Heading out of the room, Claire went back down the hallway she previously scoured, and headed further in towards the side she hadn't yet explored. Upon entering the next room, she took a look around and discovered she was at a crossroads. To her left was a staircase that led to the second floor of the station, and based on the map she glanced over on the chalkboard earlier, the office where her brother worked at was only a few rooms away. On the other hand, there were still two rooms she had yet to investigate, and she knew that the two could have tools that could prove to be valuable in the future.

"I know I came here to find Chris..." Claire tapped her chin(s) in thought while furrowing her brow as she considered her options, "but charging on ahead without taking it slow got me into this entire mess in the first place." She took a glance back at the stairs, and then stared down at herself. Also I really am not looking forward to hauling myself up that flight of stairs. Once she came to a decision, she looked up, and headed over to...
13211112211211211211221.title: Sudden Cravings and New Information...

choices: Go left. After all, she might find some info on Chris's whereabouts.
Investigate the Lion statue. Something was off about it.
Go right. See if she can open that weird door.
132111122112112112112211.content:
Contemplating on her next move, Claire looked back at the staircase, then looked toward where the remaining two rooms were located. She needed to know that her brother at least got out of the city before things took a nosedive. From there, cupped the lower hem of her blubbery stomach in mixed feelings of frustration and mild annoyance.

"*sigh* ...I guess I got no choice to head upstairs if I want to know what happened to Chris." She said to herself, where she began what would be an arduous climb up what was measly a flight of stair. Or at least, back when she didn't weigh 350 pounds. First, she clamped onto the staircase railing with a left meaty hand for support in case her girth and "passengers" had other ideas.

"Okay... Here goes nothing. God, I'm gonna hate this." She frustratingly remarked, where Claire began to slowly lumber her wide self up each step, feeling a bit more winded with every 2 to 3 steps, as a thin stream of sweat cascaded down her cherubic face. Alas, as she was halfway there, Claire soon felt her slimy bodyguards squirming about, as if they were irritated or whining.

Her brow furrowed in mild annoyance, briefly slapping her spare tire of a belly in response to the gurgling, frustratingly muttering, "Will you stop that?! I know you guys probably hate stairs, but I'm still the one in charge here. Got it?" Surprisingly, as if they read her mind, the slimes stopped gurgling inside her, as if to convey an affirmative answer.

"Hmph. Finally, something we can apparently agree on apparently." Claire retorted, only for her subconscious to overlay her thoughts for a brief moment as they said, "I just hope I haven't upset them or anything."

"*growl* Stop that, Claire!" She exclaimed to herself, lightly smacking the side of her head to refocus herself. Eventually, after what felt like several hours, Claire finally reached the top of the stairs, much to the chagrin of her established girth, panting and huffing in a exerted manner.

"*huff* *huff* *huff* Okay... I am not...*huff* *huff*...Going up stairs like this again, *huff* that's *huff* *huff* ...for sure." Claire panted, feeling the fatigue of weighing over 300 pounds. Suffice to say, it certainly put things in perspective for the female Redfield, whilst she took a momentary respite to catch her breath.

She turned her head to the left and saw a doorway that will probably lead her to where her brother and his friends work at. Hopefully. Meanwhile, in front of her, she noticed a bronze Lion statue before her, propping it's right forepaw upon an equally bronze kite shield, which appeared to contain something inside it, with three symbols upon a pedestal the statue stood upon.

Then, looking to her right, there was another door, only it had what appeared to be a crystalline spade symbol adorned upon the door. How strange. Weighing her options while she caught her breath, Claire eventually decided to...
132111122112112112112211.title: Stairs: A Fat Girl's Enemy

choices: Head to the S.T.A.R.S office, she needs to find Chris!
It wouldn't hurt to check out the Spade door at least?
1321111221121121121122112.content:
"That statue looks a bit odd..." Claire muttered, taking a closer look at the stony visage of the king of the jungle. "What are these symbols for?" She scratched her cheek in confusion after catching sight of a few parts of the statue's base that looked like dials. The pictures themselves were of different objects or animals that seemed to have no real relevance to each other as far as Claire could tell. One was a branch, another a picture of the head of the statue's subject itself, and a bird as the final symbol. "I wonder what these could...oh!" Claire blinked as she ran her hand over the image of the lion trying to press it, only to find that it rotated instead of depressing inwards as she thought it would.

"Okay...so this seems like a match the symbols game..." Claire observed, finding that all three of the sections rotated between the aforementioned set of pictures. As far as Claire could tell, once she actually found the right combination she'd simply let it sit and then wait for...something to happen. "Only thing is I don't know the combination that works..." Claire sighed, knowing that she'd probably have to go somewhere else to figure out what pictures would provide the right combo. However, as she went to step away to look elsewhere, the burn in her leg muscles reminded her of the arduous journey they'd weathered to make it to the statue in the first place. "Yep, screw that!" Claire growled, turning right back around to face the statue, "I'm still winded from those stairs, so no way in hell am I running around this godforsaken place when I'm as fat as baby hippo."

Nostrils flaring in frustration, Claire set about solving the puzzle the only way she knew how. Trial, error, and a whole lot of patience on her part. First up, she figured she'd go with eagle, eagle, eagle. "Nope, nothing..." Claire huffed, before planting an elbow tiredly on the statue and resting her head in her hand. Eagle, branch eagle? No dice. Eagle, eagle, branch? Nadda. "I'm gonna be here for a bit I guess." Claire muttered, looking around the room before spotting a chair that would hopefully hold her rather hefty body. "Just gonna go ahead and use this to get a little more comfy..." After pulling the chair over and wincing as the chair protested with a rather loud set of creaks, Claire smiled in relief that it hadn't crumpled underneath her before getting back to the task at hand...

Many tries later...

"Oh my Gooooood!" Claire groaned, slamming a hand down in frustration for the umpteenth time as nothing happened with the combination she'd tried. "Who even built something like this! Whose mind was twisted enough?" She laughed, placing a hand over her eyes as she continued to rant, "oh look at me, I'm an architect who set a statue of a lion up with some stupid locker combination like lion, branch, eagle and expected people to-"

*DING! Skkrrrrrrrrt*

Claire paused after hearing the chipper tone and what sounded like stone scraping against itself before looking up from her annoyed rambling. Sure enough, after uncovering her eyes her vision registered that against all odds she'd finally "solved" the puzzle completely by accident. Claire's face was blank at first, before a grin slowly began to form, "hah! and Chris said my 'brute smarts' would never get me anywhere!" Heaving herself up back to a standing position, she reached inside to pull out a rather heavy hunk of bronze with the face of yet another lion, looking as ferocious as it did in the statue. "Well, go figure I guess," Claire shrugged, wondering what she could possibly use this thing for. "Maybe I could stuff it in a zombie's mouth whenever they try to bite me? Nah..."

Claire huffed to herself. The nerve of this statue's commissioner! Making a girl climb a flight of stairs only to solve some dumb puzzle and not even put anything good in the statue as a reward for solving it? "Ah forget this!" Claire raised the hunk of metal in anger and went to hurl it at the wall before remembering something.

Earlier...

Back when Claire had first entered the Raccoon City Police Station, and been 100 pounds lighter, she'd come across something in the main hall that gave her pause. It was another statue of what Claire presumed was some significant historical figure. What caught her eye about it was the three indentations near the bottom of the statue's foundation. "Almost like something would fit in there..." Claire guessed. At that moment in time however, Claire had no tools or information of any sort that might be of use to her, and so she continued on.

Presently...

"Maybe...just maybe..." Claire hesitated, bringing the Bronze Lion disc back down to her face to look at it once more. It seemed to be the right shape and size of the holes in the entrance's statue to her. "Only one way to find out I guess..." She declared, looking behind the Lion statue to see a railing, and more importantly, the distant image of the main statue and the entrance hall she'd arrived through. Unfortunately, the only way down to get there was a rather large set of... "stairs..." Claire blanched, her daycare's worth of blobs squirming lightly at her words. "Yeah that's a haaaaard pass on that!" She told her belly, patting it reassuringly, "buuuuuuuut I have an idea!" She smiled, opening her mouth, and swiftly closing it after one of the blobs had exited her maw as planned, though it seemed to tilt its mass around in confusion after spotting no enemies in the immediate area. Turning back to its glorified babysitter, it began to slow climb back up Claire's leg, before halting as the woman in question held a hand out.

"Hang on there little guy," Claire chuckled, "I need you to take this over to that statue and put it into one of the holes at the bottom of it." she held out the medallion to the blob, before pointing to its intended destination. The blob turned to where her finger pointed, and then back to her before quivering lightly as if nodding to show that it understood her request. The blob then took the Lion Medallion into its mass before rushing off as quick as it could.

Claire watched with bated breath as it trekked down the stairs and to the Main Hall's centerpiece. Once there she squinted her eyes in concentration as she focused in on her courier deposit the metal ring into one of the indentations. After it did so, Claire waited for a few seconds, before hearing a faint *click* and the sound of stone moving. Looking down at the statue, she saw that it had sank just slightly, and one of the marble and limestone rings had unfurled itself from the platform the statue's figure was resting on. "Huh. I guess that worked!" Claire nodded to herself. Now she at least had a goal to work towards after finding information on Chris' whereabouts. "Finding the two other medallions is gonna be hell if they aren't in two more of those statues though...ah well no use sweating it now."

Come on back! She thought, hoping that her mental link with the blob wouldn't peter out at this range. Luckily, it seemed that her message had been received as she watched her charge slowly make its way back to her. Once it arrived, it paused at her feet to her surprise, as normally it would have eagerly leapt up to get back to its brethren contained within her stomach. "What's wrong? Not feeling it?" Getting down on her knees, she held a hand out to the blob and gestured it forward, "come on, I'll let you back out later I promise!" Despite her coaxing, the blob still seemed hesitant to return, however, it did move closer to her hand and almost seemed to lean into it- "ohhhh I see." Claire rolled her eyes as she chuckled, running a hand over the blob and patting it a few times, feeling the viscous liquid it was composed of wet her hand a bit. This grossed her out slightly, but by this point she was housing an entire team of six inside her so she maintained her composure as she showered her ally with light praise.

"You did a good job little guy, keep up the good work!" She smiled warmly at it. With that, the blob finally seemed satisfied as it made its way into her waiting mouth and slid back into its home. "Alrighty...next up..." Claire grunted, getting back to her feet, "figure out where Chris is. Now if I remember that drawing on the board, the S.T.A.R.S office was... that way!" She snapped her fingers and looked back down the hallway to her left as she recalled the layout of the second floor the drawing had conveyed. Beginning her journey once more...Claire smiled to herself, maybe having these little rascals around isn't so bad...

After continuing on Claire came back to the choice she'd had before. Either check out the door with what looked like the symbol of a crystal spade adorning it, or the much more normal door that seemed to be the right direction to the S.T.A.R.S office?
1321111221121121121122112.title: Puzzles, what Puzzles?

choices: Back up the stairs to investigate the weird door...
Back into the S.T.A.R.S office hallway to go further down...
13211112211211211211221121.content:
No, I've messed around here long enough. Claire decided firmly, before slowly beginning her march down the hallway to her left, fattened hips swinging widely as she at least tried to break a walking pace. Any extra time I take somewhere else is time Chris might be in trouble...or worse... Her heart sank at the idea of her brother fighting these things off and being overrun, or more terrifyingly, joining the endless ranks of the many nameless zombies she'd already encountered.

"Easy Claire," the Redfield sister breathed, pausing for a minute to calm her nerves and fight off the anxiety that the lack of knowledge on her brother was bringing her. "Chris can handle himself, there's no way he couldn't take these guys easy. I mean...if I can do it like this..." She directed a pointed stare at her rotund body. Fortunately, the light deprecation did provide some much needed reassurance for Claire as she started to calm down a bit, letting her think a bit more clearly. "Alright, now if I remember that drawing, the office I'm looking for should be...this door." She stopped in front of a door that bore a logo composed of three bright yellow stars encased in a blue ring with white trim. However, just in case one couldn't grasp what the logo itself meant, the ring extended itself to include the word "S.T.A.R.S" above the namesakes images that were also encircled between "Raccoon Police DEP."

Cheering silently at the possibility of reaching her goal, Claire opened the door to see an office that was in slight disarray. However, compared to the state of the rest of the Police Station, the state the room was in was by far the cleanest Claire had yet to lay eyes on. Multiple desks were connected throughout the room, and each had their own desktop computer which was surrounded by multiple important looking documents and files. However, as Claire looked to her left and right throughout the room, she frowned as she realized the person she came for was nowhere to be found.

"Oh Chris...where could you be..." she whispered sadly, shaking her head as she once again had no clue on where her beloved sibling might be. "Maybe his desk might have something?" Claire wondered, before lumbering over to the desk with her brother's nameplate adorning it. Sifting through the documents, she finally came upon one letter that was addressed to the other members of S.T.A.R.S.

"To my bestest S.T.A.R.S. buds," Claire fought back a giggle, but failed to snifle a small snort that escaped her nose. Shaking her head, Claire read the body of the letter.

'How are you all doing in that drab, old station? Hanging in there against old Irons? Me? I just got back from a date with a hot chick. Bet you can guess what we got up to under her extra-large umbrella. Europe is amazing. One month is in no way enough to even scratch the surface. Maybe I'll extend my vacation for another six months. Barry, don't you even think of coming to join me. Wouldn't want to make all the cute girls cry, yeah? So you just leave the babes to me. Jill, if Claire tries to contact you, please let her know I'm OK.'

"Uh huh, Chris Redfield, my brother? And a 'hot chick?'" Claire snickered as she finished reading the document with as much of a straight face as she could, "yeah, now I know something is up...at least I know wherever he is, he's fine." Claire sighed, relieved as she pocketed the letter for safekeeping in her currently skintight sweatpants. "I guess it couldn't hurt to search the rest of the place though..." With a newfound sense of vigor at knowing her brother was safe, Claire investigated the rest of the room, and discovered that the armory at the back of the room had been left open for some reason. "Huh...odd that they would leave it open just like that..." However, not one to look a gift horse in the mouth she quickly made her way over to it and went inside.

To her delight, she walked in and immediately found the very thing she'd been hoping to find since her arrival. "Guns!" She chirped in excitement as she saw a handgun on a nearby table and what looked to be a submachine gun inside one of the open lockers along with some ammo for each next to their respective firearms.

The handgun itself seemed to be modeled after a revolver based on the rotating middle of the gun, but was of a much lighter caliber unlike its well know .44 caliber cousin. Claire remembered that Chris had showed her this model before, the "SLS 60" if she remembered right. He'd even ended up buying one for her and teaching her how to handle it for self defense purposes, but unfortunately she'd left hers back home before she'd left for Raccoon City. "Well that's at least something I know how to use alright, now for the other one." Wrapping the holster for the handgun around her thigh, no way it was getting around her waist at this point, and inserting the pistol into its intended home, Claire reached for her next prize.

This one she didn't know too much about, but she'd remembered Chris using one at the firing range for a session, the "MQ-11" or something along those lines. Whatever the case, it seemed to be relatively easy to use and at any rate, Claire would likely need something heavier hitting than the handgun she'd acquired as well. As for the ammo, Claire luckily found two hip pouches to carry them in, and placed the submachine gun in the largest carrying compartment of the pouches. "Alright, armed and ready for action!" Claire cheered, raising a fist in triumph. "Oh hang on, what's this?" She stopped, noticing a card on the table she'd grabbed the pistol off of. "Downstairs Locker Keycard...guess I should...oh no..." Claire wailed as she realized what she had to do.

Use the stairs.

"Well...Fine..." She sighed, resigning herself to her fate as she headed back out into the hallway to begin her slow descent. This time, Claire opted to place both of her sausage fingered digits firmly on both sides of the staircase to steady herself, letting her belly be subjected to the laws of physics. Descending the first step, she winced as she felt her stomach lurch and then wobble vigorously as she placed both feet on the next step down. The blobs inside her squirmed at the disturbance as Claire sighed, choosing to ignore the seemingly angry reaction from her brood. "I. Hate. These. Stairs," she growled, punctuating each jiggle, and every step with a choice word or two, her breasts nearly smacking her in the face each time her feet landed. "Why. Don't. They. Have. An. Elevator!" Finally, after nearly losing her balance from her quivering, massive behind throwing off her center of gravity, she made it back down to the first floor.

"Okay!" She huffed, blowing a few rogue strands of hair away from her eyes, "now that I'm back here, the weapons locker!" Luckily for her, and more importantly, her legs, the weapons locker room was right across from the staircase. The locker room itself seemed like a renovated gym locker room, but with locks being controlled by a keypad at the front of the room. Unfortunately, it seemed as though most of the lockers had already been opened and the items within taken out. However, in the distance, Claire spotted a back portion of the room sealed off by a gate with a keycard reader next to it.

Taking the first steps towards the rear of the room, Claire quickly found a problem in reaching her destination. "Stupid...lockers!" She grunted, trying to squeeze through the room as she felt her arms collide with the wall and the front of the lockers to her left. "Why make this room so narrow?" She groaned, before turning to the side so her stomach faced the wall. "Bear with me you guys, this'll get a little bumpy..." she warned before scooting towards the back of the room. Just as she thought, her protruding belly scraped along the wall the whole way through, and the more she continued, the more active the blobs got, as if protesting the conditions they were being subjected to.

Finally, after what seemed like forever, Claire swiped the keycard in the reader and flung herself into the backroom she'd been questing for. "Ohhh...this better have been oh hello~" She whistled, awestruck at the device in front of her. The label next to it said "GM-79" but from what Claire could tell it was a launcher of some sort. Picking it up and studying the weapon intently, Claire knew somehow that she'd be wanting to keep this baby around for quite a while. "Oh what's this? Another document?" She said, plucking a note that had been placed behind the new addition to her arsenal.

"To all members of the staff, we have been authorized the use of the GM-79 Grenade Launcher in order to stave whatever the hell these things are. I'm not sure what to call them but they're just formless ooze that chases us down relentlessly. I've seen its approach and for some reason it attacks men and women in drastically different ways. With males it simply tackles them to the ground and disintegrates them like some sort of very lethal pool of acid. With the female officer I observed however it tried to make her ingest it. Anyways, curious behavior aside, it seems flame rounds and acid rounds don't do anything to them, but luckily our boys in the lab have been experimenting with some new cryogenic ammo, and that seems to keep them at bay. Ple-

"Seems like something got him before he could finish." Claire shuddered, but looked at the canisters next to her, colored a light blue. "Cryo rounds huh?" She wondered, before picking one up and studying the label, which read 'caution: experimental rounds, handle with extreme care as exposure to extremely cold temperatures can risk many injuries.' "Well I've got five here, might as well take em with me." Placing the rounds in her pouches, she sighed and began the close quarters trip back.

"Never again." Claire vowed, before deciding where to go next. She went...
13211112211211211211221121.title: A S.T.A.R.T.L.I.N.G. Discovery...

choices: Explore some of the previous rooms. The key might be there.
Search the unexplored rooms. The key could be waiting inside.
Actually, before she could decide, Claire heard an audible noise in the distance
132111122112112112112211211.content:
"*sigh* God I hate this part." Claire said to herself, reluctantly heaving her rotund self up the flight of stairs, much to her exasperated girth's livid objections. But whilst she slowly ascended back up onto the second floor, her thoughts returned on what that earlier not said regarding the oozing slimes.

She looked down at the Grenade Launcher she grasped onto, as she thoughts proclaimed, "Okay... So apparently, those slimes are weak to these "Cryo Rounds" that note mentioned. *sigh* I must admit, I'm becoming a bit fond with those little blobs."

For a brief moment, she stopped at the final step, inspecting the Grenade Launcher in her hand, flicking open the barrel with a contemplative look on her round face and multiple chins, seeing that the weapon was already loaded with a single Flame Round. From there, she pulled out one of the experimental Cryo Rounds in an inquisitive manner, inspecting it before putting it back in the left hip pouch.

"...If what that officer said is true about those blobs being weak to these things, I'd better not use them while my new "friends" are squirming about." Claire thought once more, where she then instinctively flicked the Grenade Launcher closed out of preparation, where she then ascended up the last step, which was easier said than done compared to the entire staircase in her current physique.

"*huff* *huff* Okay then. Let's *huff* see what's behind that door, then." Claire thought aloud, waddling toward the Spade Door after catching her breath. Of course, due to her now bulkier appearance, Claire easily felt her burgeoning hips scrape a smidgen against one of the passing columns on the walkway leading to the strange door, mumbling to herself as she muttered, "*sigh* I just hope that I don't get too big for my britches. Otherwise, getting through these stupidly narrow halls are going to be an effing pain."

Finally, she reached the weird door, where upon closer inspection, where it indeed had the symbol of a Spade adorned on the door's center. At first, Claire simply began to turn the doorknob, only to be flat-out denied with an audible rustling clicking noise. She tried a few times for confirmation, which only seemed to infuriate her a bit, which resulted in her using her newfound mass to ram into the door, yet it wouldn't budge.

"Dammit!!! What the hell is with this place?!" She yelled, giving the door an instinctive yet frustrated punt kick in response, showing her anger some from all this supposed bullshit that has been occurring.

Overall, there was no way past the door without...SOMETHING to open it. But then, Claire noticed a keyhole in the center of the doorknob, which made her exhale an annoyed sigh in response as she said, "*sigh* Okay, so I have to find a stupid key that matches this asshole of a door. *growling sigh* I swear, if this Chief Irons guy is responsible for so much as a wild goose chase in here, I might just think about sick you guys on him after my go at him."

Obviously, she referred to the small group of blobs residing in her stomach, placing a hand over the outermost curve of her spare tire of a belly. "*sigh* Might as well get started on searching for that damned key, then." She muttered, which meant more exploring to do, much to the mild aching of her now thicker legs.

At least she'll probably find more ammunition for her newly acquired weapons lying about somewhere. After all, it was only a matter of searching. However, since she was here, she might've missed this Spade Key while she was exploring the Police Station in some of the previous rooms. Or maybe it was in the previously unexplored rooms back at the main lobby.

In the end though, Claire decided to...
132111122112112112112211211.title: Stairs: The Sequel & A Strange Door

choices: She fought off the urge and took down the zombies with her Pistol...
She couldn't fight the urge, and opened her mouth for her new feast...
1321111221121121121122112112.content:
"Well, I might as well check the rest of the floor on this side of the building, after all, if I really want to re-check any rooms I can just double back later." Claire decided, nodding as she laid her plan out mentally. If she was right, she remembered that there had been another room just down the hall from the office where her brother worked out of. Deciding that it was a much preferable alternative than to follow the dreaded flight of stairs up even further, she set forth down the long hallway once again.

After passing the door leading to the S.T.A.R.S office Claire continued further down the hallway and found a pair of doors. One led to the left, and from the sound of it, some type of machinery seemed to be in working condition, as she heard a low hum and a small clank or bang every now and again from within the room. The other door was at the very end of the hallway, though Claire had no idea what could be behind that one. Luckily, none of the doors carried the hated Spade symbol that taunted her so frustratingly from before, and so Claire figured she might as well go ahead and start with the closest one.

Picking up the SLS-60 handgun from her side, and sandwiching the Grenade Launcher in between a hip pouch and her hip, Claire took a deep breath and cracked the door. Seeing nothing hostile in the sliver of sight she was allowed, she slowly pushed the door open, bringing the gun up and scanning the room with it just in case. Once a couple of seconds had passed without anything jumping out at her, Claire let out the breath she'd been holding in suspense and put the gun back into its holster to actually study the room she'd wandered into.

The room size immediately caught her off guard, as it was much smaller than any of the other rooms she'd been in thus far. A lone washer and dryer combo sat in the corner of the room, the load of laundry still being cleaned as the machine kept dutifully performing its given task, despite having been abandoned for some time. In the space next to Claire sat two racks that were loaded up with towels, shirts, pants, basically all common laundry load items that one would bring to a room such as this.

"Well, not many places a key could hide," Claire hummed, picking up a shirt and rifling through the chest pocket, but only brought out a bit of lint for her troubles. Frowning, she tossed the shirt away and picked up the next garment with a sigh, "this is gonna be a pain, but I guess I'll have to search every one of these so I don't miss it..." With that, the young woman set to work searching each and every shirt and pair of pants on the racks of fabric. At first, she hand searched every pocket, or at least attempted to, since her ever increasing weight had made sure that her hands and fingers had fattened up to the point that she had trouble squeezing them into the pockets as dexterously as she once was able to. After nearly splitting the fifth pocket of her searched, she'd thrown the offending shirt away and resorted to turning each clothing item upside down and vigorously shaking them. She tried to ignore the way the flab on her arms did its best impression of gelatin as she shook each piece of clothing, but just when she learned to tune that out, her mind grew self conscious about the light bounce of her breasts, or the way her mountainous tummy barely scraped against the cool metal of the racks.

Suffice to say, Claire eventually gave up her search and left the room to clear her head before she kicked the rack over in anger. "Guess I'll check the other room then, hopefully there I'll have more room to do...anything at all." She left the laundry room and then headed back down the hall, opening the next door in just as careful a manner as she'd done previously. Passing into the next room, she let out a sigh of relief, thankful that the room was large enough to actually allow her to walk around. However, the sigh quickly caught in her throat at the sight of a statue that gave her an unwelcome reminder of one she'd recently encountered.

"Yeah no thanks mister unicorn," Claire stated flatly, giving the statue of the horned equine in front of her a heated glare as she knew what she'd have to do to make it yield its cargo. "You can keep whatever chocolate coin you have in that stupid puzzle of yours." At the words 'chocolate coin' however, her passengers immediately started squirming around, as if to convey they rather liked the idea of a giant candy based replica of the medallion they'd found before. At this, Claire poked a finger into her belly in rebuttal, narrowing her eyes at the active group. "Hey! I was joking about the coin! I'm already big enough as it is! I don't need a bad diet doing you guys' job for me too." As if they knew they were being scolded, the blobs settled down as Claire smiled in triumph, a sense that could only be described as motherly smugness that came with disciplining ones own offspring.

"Alright, now that the peanut gallery is quiet again, I can skip the stone horse and- oh come on!" Claire yelled, smacking a hand in her face as she realized the only other thing in the room was the door to her left, which, big surprise, also held the insignia of the Spade that was, as of right now, an insurmountable obstacle. "Just once I'd like to catch a break here," she growled, shaking her head as she turned back to the statue of the Unicorn. "Well...guess since I'm already here..." she sighed going up to the statue and looking at its base. Sure enough, the same three-dialed mechanism was there to greet her furrowed brow, though this time the pictures display were of two fish, a scorpion, and a vase or a jug spilling water. Figuring that the same principals applied from the last statue, Claire began her brute force method of figuring out the puzzle once more. This time however, knowing what she was in for, she was much more patient, though that didn't stop her from growing mildly annoyed at the sheer absurdity that someone would commission a statue like this in the first place.

"Ugh, finally!" Claire groaned, relieved that the combination of Fish, Scorpion, and Water Jug had been the one to undo the lock and open the hidden compartment. "I swear once I'm out of here I'm going to look up who built this place and give them a piece of my mind!" She stored her vow of frustration in the back of her mind for later, and then proceeded to reach in and pull out exactly the item she'd been expecting to find, which was a bronze disc with the face of the unicorn on it to match its container. "That's about right, now where...aha!" Claire smiled as she caught sight of the area past the railing behind the statue. Much like the Lion's display, the area past where her spot was currently overlooking was the very hall she'd come into the police station through, though this was much closer to the entrance than the lion's statue had been.

"Alright little one, you're back on!" Claire called to her stomach, opening her mouth and feeling a singular blob surge forth. She couldn't really tell the globs of slime apart, so she had no idea if this was the same one that had carried the previous medallion. Just to be safe, she explained what she needed done to the blob and directed it to carry it to the statue. With a short hop of acceptance, the blob took the Unicorn medal into its grasp and slid down the overhang into the main hall. Once it left her field of vision Claire had no way of knowing where it was, until she remembered that she could see through the blobs if they were separate from her if she focused as she'd found out from her test run back in the convenience store. Closing her eyes, she quickly found her point of view shift much lower to the ground and saw that the blob had already made it to the statue and inserted the medallion into the second slot of the mechanism.

Sure enough, upon insertion the second ring surrounding the giant marble woman's platform receded, and the statue sank a few inches for a second time. However, Claire could only faintly hear this happening despite having a front row seat through the eyes of her courier. Interesting, so I can see through them, but hearing is through my ears only... she committed that little discovery to memory before directing the blob to return to her. Cutting the visual link between them, Claire waited around until the blob made its way back up the side of the railing before letting it jump into her waiting arms.

"Good job you!" Claire praised, giving the blob a firm pat of approval before lifting it to her mouth, "time to get back to it though!" With the blob now back inside its home, Claire turned and headed back out through the door she'd come in through, pondering on what she'd seen. "So that room has two doors that are marked with the same Spade design. I guess from here I can either go to the next floor on this side, or try the other side of the station..." She finished her thought with a pensive look. Either way she'd be making a bit of a trek, either horizontally or vertically, and there was no guarantee that she wouldn't end up gaining even more weight on the way just because she had guns.

Eventually, Claire ended up deciding that she'd check upstairs since that was closer to her, and despite her growing hatred of them, she figured at this point that she needed the exercise in the long run.

Unfortunately, upon arriving back at the stairs, she discovered a trio of zombies clumsily making their way down from upstairs, falling or stumbling every other step or so. Seeing the less than graceful display, Claire rolled her eyes in amusement as she unholstered her pistol and prepared to fire at the zombies. However, as she aimed at the first zombie, that familiar feeling of hunger, to consume the zombies and grow bigger returned. She fought the urge, knowing there was no real need to use the blobs, but eventually...
1321111221121121121122112112.title: The Search for the Spade...

choices: Prioritize on finding bigger clothes. She'll most likely need them.
Prioritize on find the Spade Key. She needs to get through those doors.
Unfortunately, Claire soon heard something inhuman nearby....
13211112211211211211221121121.content:
But as the trio of undead corpses slowly limped their way towards their next meal, Claire was somehow able to fight off this strange hunger she's acquired, as she thought aloud, "Sorry, guys, but not this time." And with that, she positioned herself into a firing position with her SLS-60 pistol and began to open fire upon the miniscule zombie horde.

Of course, it was a little harder than expected, especially with the pack of blobs squirming about in her gut, demanding to be let out so they can feed. Thankfully, it was only a minor drawback, as Claire compensated by firing a few well-placed headshots upon the first zombie, causing it to collapse onto the floor.

*Grrruuuggh*

However, despite taking down a single zombie, it took up almost all five bullets in the revolver cylinder to truly defeat. So in response, Claire began to reload as quickly as her chubby fingers would allow. But by the time she fully reloaded her firearm, the second zombie clumsily lunged at her for a bite. But due to her increased body mass, Claire pushed the zombie off of her, thus knocking the walking corpse into it's compatriot.

Claire continued this process until the remaining zombies were downed...hopefully. "*sigh* Well, that wasn't as bad as I thought it would be." Claire retorted to herself, continuing her way through the derelict Police Station. But then, as she took a few waddling steps forward, she soon felt the blobs squirming once more, as well as the subtly gnawing pangs of hunger.

She stood there, looking at the staircase first, then back towards the downed zombies splayed out on the floor. But like a mother bird with her baby chicks, the blobs demanded to feed. Obviously knowing that was undoubtedly going to regret this, Claire, tapped her belly to converse with her blobs and begrudgingly commented, "*frustrated sigh* ...Alright, fine! You can eat. But you're only eating one corpse, nothing more! Got it?"

In response, the blobs heaved their gelatinous forms in confirmation, prompting Claire to fully open her mouth to allow a few of the blobs to fully emerge and slither their way over toward the nearest zombie, dissolving it and adding to their overall mass.

"*sigh* Now I know how Mom felt when she was raising me and Chris." Claire thought to herself, obviously now experiencing what motherhood was like. Or at least, in an unorthodox manner of speaking. However, before her mind could even wander off, Claire soon noticed that her slimy brood were finished with their meal, as she felt one of the blobs cutely nudge up against the side of her thick leg, as if asking to be back inside their mother's embrace.

She was certainly surprised at how obedient they were, as she noticed the other two corpses were left untouched, where she then patted the blob a few times with a reassuring demeanor, speaking to them as she maternally quipped, "Good blobs."

And with that, Claire reluctantly opened her mouth wide once more to allow the blobs passage into her stomach, which they eagerly proceeded to do, slithering up Claire's body and back into her opened maw. Suffice to say, Claire was soon going to regret this decision, as she felt the blobs deposit their excess mass into her own physique, which resulted in...

*ZZRRRIPP!!*

*RRRIIIIIPPP!!*

ZZZKKKRRIIIIIPPP!!!*

And with that, Claire soon felt her already strained sweatpants give way to her newly accumulated bulk, as she assessed the damage, which revealed a now noticeably large tear at the seat of her pants, thus exposing her now voluminous behind. Claire noticed it very easily, as she felt a light breeze touch her now partially exposed buttocks, causing her to both blush and furrow her brow in a mix of mild annoyance and frustration.

"*sigh* ...Goddammit." She audibly said to herself, now internally regretting her earlier decision, as she then noticed that the shirt she wore now rode up a few more inches, becoming more akin to a bra, as her bra had now given up the ghost, the snaps breaking on cue with her sweatpants.

"Great. Now I have to find some bigger clothes if I get any fatter than this." Claire said to herself, as she now contemplated on her next move. On one hand, she could head back to the Laundry Room and hopefully find some larger clothes before continuing her search. But on the other hand, she had to find that damned key that could open those Spade doors. Thinking it over, Claire decided to...
13211112211211211211221121121.title: Shoot First, Hunger Later

choices: Claire Steps into the Next Room...
132111122112112112112211211212.content:
"Well...It's not like anyone else is really around to see my outfit fall apart anyways..." Claire noted dryly, before lifting the bottom roll of her belly up in order to allow her foot to plant itself on the first step.

RIIIIP!

Claire sighed as she heard the telltale tear of the sweatpants she'd hoped would hold on just a little longer, but seemed convinced that they wouldn't be accompanying her any longer. Shaking her head at this turn of events Claire pressed onward, ignoring the ever increasing breeze she could feel as her sweatpants tore further and further with each part of her ascent. By the time she made it up her sweatpants had fluttered off, leaving her bottom half clad in only a pair of panties that were tight, but much less taxed than their predecessor. Unfortunately, despite their dogged determination, they did little to cover any notable part of Claire's exposed rear, the young woman turning a crimson hue at her current state of dress.

"G-Great...that's what I get for rushing ahead..." she stuttered, trying to ignore the bounce her bubble-butt made with every union that met between her feet and the ground underneath it. "Now...seems the only way ahead is through that room..." Claire gazed upon the room to her right, which had no door for an entrance on this side at least. Walking into it, Claire could see that it was modest compared to the S.T.A.R.S office, whose many papers and desks strewn about gave an air of hustle and bustle even with no officers to populate it. This office by comparison, gave off a much more relaxed air as it contained only one desk, a table with several chairs placed around it, and a board game that made Claire guess that this was a place that one could take their mind off of their work, if only for a moment. Added to that, a small set of bookshelves lay flush against the wall opposite her and bordered a window that gave an excellent nighttime view of the city, or rather, it would have if parts of the city weren't visibly aflame at this point.

"Huh...seems pretty homey compared to everywhere else here," Claire noted, noticing that a lot of the books on the shelves dealt with similar topics. "History of Raccoon City, Raccoon City Museum Renovation, Famous Figures of All Events Raccoon...man, somebody was a bit of a history buff it seems..." She scratched her head at this, never really preferring history as her favorite subject, as she preferred to live in the moment. Come to think of it maybe that's why Chris says I'm a bit headstrong as times... Grinning sheepishly, she paused for a moment as she remembered the many times her older brother ended up bailing her out of the mischief she usually seemed to get herself into. The more she thought about it however, the more she looked at herself and realized she had no Chris to get her out of this situation she was stuck in.

"Well, I'm not sure what Chris would think if he saw me now, but I don't know if he would call me his 'little' sister now." She chuckled, before deciding she'd spent long enough reminiscing and got back to looking for the Spade Key. "Now if I were a key where would I hide?" She hummed to herself, nothing on the table, or on the desk, so those were out. She scooted the chairs out of the way just in case the key had fallen underneath the seats, but still her search proved fruitless. After nearly getting ready to flip the table over to check underneath that, a gleam in the corner of her eye caught her attention, and she swiveled her head towards the window-sill at the brief flash of light.

"Aha! Thought you could hide eh?" She crowed, picking the key up from the window and inspecting it. Much to her delight, Claire confirmed that the key she'd picked up was indeed the elusive guardian of the Spade doors that had vexed her so. With a short, joyful laugh, Claire spun around and merrily skipped, or rather slightly raised herself on her tiptoes, back to the stairs, only breaking her celebration to make her way back down the stairs.

However, instead of going straight for the first Spade door that met her sight as she arrived back down to the second floor, Claire realized that now might be a good time for her to grab that change of clothes from before that she'd desperately been needing. Even if nobody alive might come across her, it certainly did no good to give the zombies a big fleshy target to home in on if she could help it.

Bursting back into the laundry room with a much happier feel to her step, Claire found herself happily singing a short tune as she sought to remedy her pants-less conundrum.
