At first, all Claire could come across were work jeans or pants that were either way too tight, or just felt uncomfortable after doing the button up, the denim scratching the underside of her muffin top and threatening to start chafing even after the brief period she had it on. Finally, after going through ten or fifteen pairs of pants in the laundry stack, she found a black pair of dress slacks that seemed to be flexible enough, and didn't cut into her flabby gut flesh at any level of discomfort. Next up on the docket of replacement clothing was her shirt, which was still holding on quite well much to her surprise, but the more she could cover up her belly, the less self conscious she'd feel about it. After seeing that most of the white button up dress shirts wouldn't fit her, she came across a white shirt and grey sweater vest combo that seemed...rather large compared to the rest of the clothing she'd sorted through.

"Well, I don't care much for the outfit, but since it looks like the only thing that'll fit me better..." Claire sighed and wrenched her tattered black t-shirt off, shivering as her fat-filled bust lay exposed except for the small portions that were covered by her red jacket, which seemed to be in way better condition than everything else considering the circumstances. After donning the white shirt and sweater vest, she found that she was correct in her initial assessment, as she saw that the shirt had no trouble reaching around her bust, what are they even at this point? F-cups? G-cups? Claire wondered, eyeing her pair of twins that were quite possibly the only part of her growth she was at least somewhat happy with, even if they did get in the way a bit. With at least the top half of her stomach covered now, though her belly button was still out and about for the world to observe, Claire donned her red jacket once again and sized up her appearance in the mirror next to the sink and washing machine.

"Well...minus the jacket I look like...a really stuffy librarian..." She huffed, frowning as she realized the triple chin that had begun rounding out her face even further, "a really stuffy obese librarian..." Blushing hotly as she started to feel put off by her portly portrait, she exited the room and went down the hall back to where she found the Unicorn statue. Upon arriving at the familiar stone exhibit of the mythical equine, she raised a hand as if to greet it before turning to her real goal, the Spade door. However, as she reached for the door handle, a rumbling in her gut made her freeze.

"That isn't the blobs squirming," she noted, as they were being eerily still, as if sensing danger beyond the door. This, she knew, was a rumbling in her gut that felt familiar, only having happened a couple times before. "Let's see, the last time this happened was out in the street when...oh no..." her eyes widened in horror as she realized what the ominous churning in her gut meant, "one of those clones pretending to be me is past here..." Knowing that she now faced a much more credible threat than any zombie or Licker, Claire pulled her hand away from the door and considered how to approach the situation. To start, she opened her mouth and summoned all of the available blobs she had stored within her. Confused as to what was going on, the six of them floundered about briefly before Claire snapped her fingers and garnered their attention.

"Hey, listen up you guys," Claire hissed, the blobs staying stock still as they received their orders, "one of my...body doubles is behind that door, made of the same stuff as you all. Now I don't know if she'll be able to take control of you guys or not so I'd rather play things safe for now. You guys go back and hide in the laundry room. If I need you, I'll let you all know from up here," she tapped her head to remind them of her mental link, "otherwise, stay hidden until then. Okay?" Whether the blobs understood every single word said to them was up for debate, however, they did seem to catch the gist of her explanation as they reluctantly filed out of the room and back down to their designated hiding spot.

Now that her charges were gone, and hopefully safe and sound, Claire shook the jitters out of herself, able to hop in place now that she was about forty or so pounds lighter. "Here goes nothing," she told herself as she took the recently acquired Spade key and inserted it into the lock. A quick turn and a quiet click signaled that the door was ready to be opened. Taking a deep breath, Claire chose to bring out her Grenade Launcher in case a fight broke out, and load it with a cryo round to prepare for the battle that was sure to break out...
132111122112112112112211211212.title: The Key to Success is Staying On Target...

choices: Claire manages to quickly fire a cryo grenade, gaining the advantage!
The clone manages to fire a slime at her, but Claire dodges nimbly somehow!
Claire tries to dodge, but trips and gets overwhelmed...
1321111221121121121122112112121.content:
Upon entering the next room, Claire saw that the Spade door had been hiding a massive library whose square footing rivaled that of the Main Hall's. Bookshelves towered above her with a countless collection of doubtlessly old tomes and records that one could spend their life pouring over. However, that's not what Claire was focusing on as an unamused scowl crossed her face. What had caught Claire's attention, was the figure sitting casually above her on one of the bookshelves, kicking her legs like a school-child without a care in the world. Of course, the malevolent smirk that adorned the figure's face showed that they were anything but innocent or well-meaning.

"Well well well...I was wondering when you would show up sweetie!" The person giggled teasingly in a perfect replica of Claire's own voice. "You sure took your time in getting here...oh but I suppose you have seemed to pack on a few pounds since our last meeting..." The doppelganger gestured to her stomach, "a bit here, a bit there," she pointed to her own slim visage for reference, before shrugging and waving a hand over the rest of her body "quite a bit everywhere really, you oughta lay off the junk food Claire. It's not doing any favors for your figure."

"Bite me!" Claire growled, her anger rising at both the nonchalance she was being treated with and the obvious jabs at her growing waistline. "You're the ones that started this mess in the first place! In fact, you wouldn't even be up there if it weren't for me!"

"And your contribution is duly noted, and oh so appreciated~" the clone snarked with a patronizing snicker. "Unfortunately, I have no desire to compensate you for your efforts with any monetary gains, but perhaps I can let you ah, 'gain' an opportunity of a different nature."

"What are you-"

"Oh ladieeees~" The copycat cut Claire off with a snap of her fingers and a melodious chime of her voice. Immediately, Claire heard a set of groans and the familiar shuffle of feet coming from behind the furthest bookshelves from her position. Claire narrowed her eyes as she mentally braced herself for what new horrors would await her behind the barrier of paperback and wood.

That moment of preparation was not nearly enough.

What emerged from behind the bookshelves were a pair of female zombies that were so bloated, so huge, so disgustingly weighed down by the layers of fat that had accumulated on them that it was a blatant disregard of the laws of nature as to how they were even capable of movement. Claire thought before that she'd been the fattest thing in this police station, but these things?

They look double my size, or even more... Claire gulped, finding herself speechless at the sheer mass of each quivering, slime hoarding undead, they have to weigh at least seven to eight hundred pounds, if not half a ton... Realizing that she was so caught up in the sheer off-putting appearance of the two, that she'd forgotten about the real threat, she tore her eyes away from the pair of gurgling giants and saw that her other self had leapt down from the bookshelf and onto the floor.

"Well, what do ya think?" She held her hands out in display, as if she were a twisted ringmaster in the most contemptible circus imaginable. "These lovely pair are twin sisters, and were in a pretty nice neighborhood before the walking grave fillers took over."

"What the hell did you do to them?" Claire shouted, hefting her Grenade Launcher so that the sight was aiming squarely at her so called twin. "How on Earth are they even still moving?"

"Funny story actually..." The clone giggled, flashing a deceptively sweet grin that gave way to obvious malicious intent, "you might've come across a couple of our kind that took down those poor excuses for rotten meat and turned a beautiful hue of green?"

"That's not the word I'd use." Claire snorted.

"Well you see," 'Claire' rolled her eyes, ignoring the deadpan response of her progenitor, "once we saw this happen, we realized that the virus responsible for this plague of flesh eaters could be...incubated, and replicated instead of eradicated like our kind would normally do. A side effect of this replication process is that the individual turns a shade of green."

This explains why I didn't turn into a zombie despite eating at least six or seven of them... Claire realized, smiling at the thought of her brood of slimes unknowingly protecting her before she directed a heated glare back at her mirror image. "That doesn't explain these two though."

"Don't worry that's up next," the clone winked, before walking up to one of the flab-ridden fiends and wrapping an arm around its neck affectionately, "it turns out that since we replicate the virus, we also carry a much higher concentration of it, and so turning someone from human, to not so human? A mere hour or so, instead of a day."

"You monsters..." Claire growled, feeling another surge of anger course through her as she slowly pieced together where the story was going.

"Oh seems you figured me out," the clone laughed, slamming her hand down in the air as if she were ringing a bell, "ding ding! That's right! Once we found these lovely ladies trying so desperately to escape, we simply fed them our...point of view and a little more, and by the next hour or so they came to see things our way! Helps that once they had no mind of their own that we could get rid of those hindrances like bones and muscles and fill their bodies with more of us to provide them freedom of movement even at a size such as this."

Woah...so no bones or muscles left in there huh? Claire blinked in surprise, them being filled only with slimes explains why they aren't snapping their own legs in half with their weight.

"You're pretty quick to catch on to my little story Claire," the clone flashed a smile before unhooking her arm from the zombie and stepping forth, that's why I've decided to give you an extra special opportunity, one you can't possibly refu-"

*Bang*

A bullet streaked across the room and struck the dastardly doppelganger in the head mid-speech, having been fired from Claire's handgun in a spur of the moment decision to try and catch the slimmer and trimmer version of herself off guard.

"That's what I think of whatever possible offer you could throw my way!" Claire spat, though her look of anger faltered as her clone snapped her neck back forward to stare at her with a chillingly neutral expression.

"Oh Claire...you must have misunderstood me..." the clone chuckled as she casually plucked the bullet out of her head and flicked it away as if it were no more than a mosquito bothering her. "You can't possibly refuse this offer, buuuuut if you insist upon putting up some paltry resistance then I'll humor you..." She took another step towards Claire, after all, it's the least I can do before I let you join these cute little butterballs as another one of our slime breeding factory, or I guess in your case it would be rejoin? The clone shook her head in deliberation, before directing a grin at Claire, "of course, this time, we won't be letting you have the luxury of being alive and with the freedom of thought to get in our way again."

So she wants to fatten me up into one of those things then? Claire huffed to herself as she put on a confident smirk. I guess we'll see just how well these cryo round work then, it'll be worth it if I can wipe the smug grin off of her annoying face! Or...my face? Whatever! Regardless of the semantics of whose face was really annoying her, Claire knew she had to win this fight, or else become a non-thinking, slime creating ball of undead tonnage.

As the fight commenced...
1321111221121121121122112112121.title: The Terrible Trio...

choices: After the clone left, Claire recalled the blobs back to her.
From there, Claire used the Spade Key, then recalled her brood.
Unfortunately, Claire soon heard something inhuman nearby....
13211112211211211211221121121211.content:
Despite her rotund frame, Claire now easily had more flexibility and maneuverability at her disposal, especially since her brood weren't inside her stomach for the time being.

The elephantine zombie twins gurgled and lumbered their way toward the plump Redfield, but Claire outpaced them, as she quickly fired off a cryo grenade from the Grenade Launcher, which landed in the middle of the waddling lard and slime-filled corpses, which detonated on impact with the ground.

In turn, this unleashed a wide but extremely chilling cloud of icy blue liquid nitrogen, which started to engulf and cover up the lower half of the blubbery undead duo. At first, Claire could only see that it was seemingly ineffective, as she silently cursed, "Dammit! It's not working!" However, that tone soon changed when she noticed something peculiar happening to her two decaying assailants.

The bloated female zombies appeared to be cracking apart, literally, as their lower bodies shattered like glass in a matter of seconds, causing them to collapse onto the floor with an audibly loud *CRUNCH!!* in response to their coldly dismembered lower halves. Claire couldn't help but display a cheery, satisfied, and relieved dimpled grin upon her chubby cheeks, as she mentally exclaimed, "Hell yeah!! Now that's what I'm talking about!"

But yet, despite the effectiveness of the cryogenic grenade rounds against the elephantine zombie twins, the gas cloud slowly began to dissipate, which gave Claire the incentive to fire off another round against the now downed zombies to continue the barrage. Of course, just like before, the cloud of liquid nitrogen began to take a fatal toll on the fattened zombie duo, effectively freezing them in place, whilst one defiantly attempted to reach out toward the rotund brunette, only to be rendered completely frozen by the liquid nitrogen encapsulating it's slime-filled corpse frozen solid.

"Hmph! Not so tough now, are you?" Claire smugly scoffed, where she triumphantly bashed the first frozen zombie with the buttstock of the Grenade Launcher, then proceeded to do the same with the other one as well, causing the now frozen zombies to shatter like a porcelain vase being dropped onto the floor.

However, despite such a surprising victory, 'Claire', still standing before her progenitor whilst observing the brief battle in front of her, as she bore an inquisitive look and posture before the chubbier Claire, as the slimy duplicate put a hand under her chin, all while bearing a curiously cheeky smirk upon it's face. But as Claire shot a heated glare at her thinner doppelganger, 'Claire' spoke up and inquisitively quipped, "Hmmm.... Intriguing. Very intriguing, indeed. I can see you have found the means to combat Us, my dear."

"Heh! Yeah, that's right, you copycat bitch. I've found your Achilles Heel, and I'm not afraid to twist the knife." Claire smugly replied, loading another cryo grenade into the Grenade Launcher, then aiming the weapon at her slime-coated doppelganger. And yet, she couldn't help but feel like something was...off, regarding her clone's current disposition.

"*giggle* Maybe so, darling. However, since we are feeling rather generous, we shall let you be...at least for now, anyway." 'Claire' elaborated, with outstretched arms, as if tempting the real Claire to open fire upon her and waste precious ammunition. However, Claire was no fool after her first encounter, as the clone smugly exited from the room to leave her progenitor for the time being.
13211112211211211211221121121211.title: A Triumphant Retaliation

choices: From there, Claire proceeded to activate the Detonator.
However, Claire just noticed some things on a nearby table.
Oh no! Claire's not the only one in the room!
132111122112112112112211211212112.content:
"*sigh* ...Well, at least I know she'll eventually pop back up again. Here's hoping I'm a bit more prepared next time." Claire thought to herself, exhaling an almost husky sigh of relief, despite being unable to truly finish off one of her wretched clones.

She quickly looked to her left, then to her right, just to make sure the room was clear before proceeding to the locked door. "So far, so good." She noted, where she soon waddled over to the locked door, equipped with the Spade Key. From there, she posthumously inserted the key into the keyhole, and turned it to hear a cathartic *click-click* in the process, as what appeared to be a satisfied grin appeared on her cherubic face.

"Better call them in in to let them know it's safe out here." Claire thought, but just as she slowly turned around to return to the pack of pet-sized green blobs, she soon felt a wet sensation on her right leg, prompting her to look down, seeing the aforementioned slimes already before her.

Suffice to say, it certainly surprised her a little, briefly forgetting that these creatures, despite their translucent gelatinous forms, had a decent amount of intelligence. "Wow. That was fast." She said aloud, to which the small group of blobs jiggled somewhat as if to convey a semblance of emotion due to their extreme lack of facial features. However, Claire couldn't help but feel like she was gradually becoming attached to these gelatinous creatures, remembering what her sexually sadistic clone said earlier.

In response, despite her now established heft and girth, Claire slowly knelt down, petting the blob closest to her akin to petting a pet dog, a small smile appearing whilst she acknowledged, "...I guess I should be thanking you little guys for keeping me safe this whole time, huh? Even after eating several zombies sometime ago."

The blobs briefly wobbled in a vertical motion, like a pet Golden Retriever being rewarded with a tasty biscuit, as if being thankful for their mistress's kind yet blunt words. "Now...What do you say we find a way outta here, hmm? Come on." Claire retorted, where she calmly opened her mouth wide enough for the pack of green slimes to promptly enter their "Mother's" body, to which they responded with glee, forming a single file line into her open maw.

Almost a minute later, the last slime had finally descended down her throat and into her stomach alongside it's siblings. From there, with a little bit of difficulty on her part, Claire stood back up, her stomach returning to it's taut pregnant-like shape from carrying her gelatinous brood. Fortunately, she had gotten accustomed to such a predicament, as she calmly proceeded to open the Spade Door, leading her rotund self out of the Library and onto the left balcony on the second floor.

And with that, as she slowly waddled over to the other balcony, she thought, "...Here's hoping that wherever that last Medallion is at, it doesn't involve going up another flight of stairs."

== 7 Minutes Later... ==

"Stairs. *huff* *huff* It just... *huff* had to be stupid stairs..."

That was all Claire could mutter at the moment, as she finally ascended up another flight of stairs towards where the final Medallion was theoretically located. Unfortunately for her, it was on the third floor, behind the upper level of the Library. Earlier, she found both a pair of batteries, and what appeared to be a Detonation Timer for explosives. Claire made her way across the oaken walkway, hoping that the polished wooden flooring and structure doesn't buckle under her corpulent form and substantial weight, as the only sounds accompanying her were the indiscreet sounds of creaking and groaning wooden planks.

Upon making it to the other side, she promptly used the Spade Key one last time to open the door before her, forcibly making her way through, despite the narrow door frame scraping along the sides of her bulkier hips. "*sigh* I just hope I don't get stuck in the doorway way sooner than I'd like to." She mentally prayed, aiming her SLS 60 revolver in front of her should there be any more zombies or whoknowswhat lurking within the RPD Police Station.

Fortunately, only her and her slimy brood were the only living organisms in the room, just as Claire soon noticed a fresh corpse dangling upside down from a floor in the ceiling. "Gross." She noted, as she slowly lumbered into the room, revolver still out should the need arose. The room itself was more akin to a decrepit attic, with garbage and various unmentionables strewn about, blocking off one small section of the room.

"Ah-Ha! There you are!" Claire exclaimed, seeing the Maiden Statue before her, clear as day. Sadly, she soon noted that the sculpture was blocked off by a set of crude metal bars. "Dammit!" She yelled, kicking one of the bars with a stomping foot out of frustration. But then, something caught her eye, as she lumbered over to the right, as she saw what appeared to be a few blocks of C4 were placed on what appeared to be some sort of makeshift barricade.

Putting two and two together, she soon realized that the Detonator was actually meant for blowing up the barricade, as a cathartic smirk appeared on her plump face, now knowing what had to be done here.
132111122112112112112211211212112.title: A Momentary Respite

13211112211211211211221121121213.content:
"Might wanna pay attention hun!" The other Claire called out mockingly, the real Claire's eyes snapping over to the call, only to widen in surprise as she saw a blob hurtling towards her. Miraculously, she deftly ducked underneath it. "Shoot I missed, oh well, more where that came from!" 'Claire' laughed as she threw a few more slimes at the chunkier version of herself.

Claire, was expecting this however, and leapt out of the way, or rather, she would have if her right foot hadn't turned awkwardly and throw a very much unneeded wrench into her plans. With a surprised cry, Claire was sent crashing to the ground, the awkward belly flop she'd landed in leaving her winded.

Come on Claire! Get up, you can't lose here! She thought to herself, her heart racing as she realized her fate should she fall here. "Have to- *huff* *huff*- have to get up..." she moaned to herself, gasping for breath as she flopped onto her back and desperately tried to prop herself up. "Just have to- oof! Ah!" She cried out as a foot was planted on her sternum.

"Oh Claire...now that was just pitiful..." The clone mockingly cooed, "I'd expected you to put up more of a fight what with that stunning display of bravado from earlier, but I suppose life is full of disappointments huh?

"Go to...hell..." Claire wheezed weakly as she coughed, wincing as the foot on her chest moved to her belly, keeping her stuck in place. Looking around wildly for her grenade launcher, she found to her horror, that her twin had picked it up and was eyeing it with interest. "No..." she whispered, reaching an arm out for it weakly.

"You were planning to use this little contraption on us I suppose?" The other Claire giggled, wiggling the gun tauntingly at her, "well, come and get it! Come on! Come on girl you can do it."

Claire growled at the display, her copy holding the gun above her just out of arm's reach, and so she simply glared at her captor in defiance. "Oh you're no fun..." The clone pouted as she realized Claire was hardly in the mood to humor her teasing antics. "Well girls if she's not willing to play, what say we make our guest of honor into the main event?"

At this, the mottled female mammoths drew closer, until they were about a foot away from Claire, however, instead of making a move to bite her as Claire expected, they simply waited, staring vacantly into space as if they didn't even remember she was directly in front of them.

"Alright, now how should we do this?" Claire heard her clone hum to herself, tapping a finger to her chin in thought as she pondered on how to proceed. Eventually, after a minute or two of deliberating, 'Claire' simply shrugged and gestured to one of the zombies, "you go first I suppose, give our dear friend Claire here a little taste of what her life will become...

"What the hell is that supposed to mean?" Claire laughed, acting as though she was resigning herself to whatever they had planned for her, but was desperately searching for something, anything nearby she could use to get away.

"Weeeeell since it can't hurt~ I suppose I can tell you!" The copycat Claire snickered as she rested her head in her hands, eyeing Claire hungrily, "you see, normally I'd be inclined to feed you a singular little zombie virus slime of mine, but leaving you with a whole hour of potential mischief in your hands is something I'd rather not risk." The clone slightly shifted its position as the zombie to Claire's left got down on its knees, "therefore, I'd rather speed up the process by letting you borrow a fair amount of weight from each of these fine ladies to get things started. Consider it a VIP gift if you will!"

Oh God no! I have to get out of here! Claire thought, beads of sweat forming, and tears starting to burn her eyes as she felt the breath of the zombie hit her face as it brought its own rotting visage closer and closer to hers. In one last act of desperation Claire tried to turn her face in the opposite direction, only to feel a hand force her to meet the deadened eyes of the undead twin.

Her clone grinned as she held Claire's face aloft with an iron grip, "Oh don't be so down, now you've at least been granted the chance to serve something...'bigger' than yourself if you catch my drift!"

"NO - mmph!" Claire was swiftly cut off as the zombie's own rancid mouth connected with her own, blocking any last words that might have been said. At first, Claire nearly vomited as all she could taste was the stench of graveyard breath in her mouth, but a splitsecond later that taste was washed away as a steady flow of slime began forcing its way down Claire's esophagus. Like tap water, the ooze made its way into Claire's stomach, slowly inflating it like a balloon as she was packed more and more with virus ridden slime against her will. Unlike her previous growths, most of the weight from this expansion went to her belly itself, though her breasts and butt slowly filled out alongside the taut drum that her abdomen was becoming.

Oh God I'm going to explode! I can't..." Claire moaned softly as she placed her hands on her expanding gut, feeling her limbs separate further and further apart as the vast expanse of pale flesh grew larger and larger. Slight stretch marks began to appear on the sides of her belly due to the speed at which her skin was forced to stretch, which was fitting giving the use her doppelganger had her lined up for.

Finally, after what seemed like hours of drinking down mouthfuls of slime, the zombie pulled away at the snap of her twin's fingers. As one would expect, the previously mammoth sized zombie was much less rotund than her sister zombie after the transfer of her slime-based essence, leaving her about two hundred pounds lighter, and Claire that much heavier. This landed the poor Redfield girl at about even with said zombie, though in much more pain as her belly cried out, skin throbbing after being pushed to its limits in such a short amount of time.

"P-Please...no more..." Claire moaned, a shaky hand tracing circles on the side of her gravid tummy before it fell tiredly to the side.

"Sorry Claire," her clone trying, and failing, to sound even somewhat apologetic, "but when I said you'd be our main event..." trailing off, the slime contortionist signaled the other zombie to approach Claire much like its foul kin did before her.

"No..." Claire pleaded softly hoping that her copy had some sense of humanity left within her. Unfortunately, the amused, joy-filled grin let her know that she was long past the bargaining stage. Tears ran freely down Claire's face as her head fell back, defeated as she let the second zombie plant its disgusting maw on her own living oral entrance. Claire's vision began to go hazy as her second meal was started to be forced down her gullet.

Buttons began popping, and seams began splitting as Claire was fattened up more and more like the prize hog she was as her thighs freed themselves from the dress slacks she'd acquired earlier, and as she looked down, her eyes were met with a cleavage most women had to pay good money to acquire as her breasts surged forward after emerging from the confines of her shirt and sweater vest. Her belly was beyond massive at this point, practically making up half her body as it rose above her like a pale mountain, though in some trick of the light, her skin looked like it was a very faint shade of grey...

Chris...help... she thought in the throes of futility, though as she breached the 700 pound mark a confused look came over her face. Chris? Who is...Chris? Don't...remember... Suddenly, it was harder and harder to form complete thoughts, her mind all muddled up from whatever was being done to her. Chris...brother...good? She thought weakly as her mind fell further and further apart. Chris...family...hungry...

Itchy...tasty... Were here last thoughts as her eyes closed, not even noticing that her skin had already begun to decay, a dark grey hue to signify she was human no longer.

"That's enough..." The clone held a hand up as the zombie rose to its feet, looking to be around the same 500 pound girth that its sister was currently at.

If one were to call them huge however, then what was once Claire Redfield certainly put them to shame. What was once a lithe young body had become a being loaded up with 850 pounds of slime and fat. Her clothes lay in tatters around her, the only thing setting her appearance apart from the numerous other zombies being the sleeves of her signature red jacket, the only survivors of her twisted growth.

"Alrighty Claire, naptime is over!" Her clone, or rather, the only Claire left standing, called, clapping her hands. With a slime-ridden gurgle, the zombie that had once been her progenitor opened her eyes and sat up. "There's a good girl! Now come on! Up and at em' we've got work to do!" The clone chirped gleefully as she stepped back from Claire's gargantuan gravidity, Signaling the trio of zombies to follow her, 'Claire' smirked as she glanced over her original's new plight. "you know Claire? I thought that these two were my best work, but you?" she smiled wryly, "you are definitely my magnum opus..."

With that, the clone began walking slowly out of the room, humming happily as her undead entourage slowly followed behind her. Two of them a pair of poor souls condemned to their fates, and the third a girl who had come to the city hoping to find her brother, but instead found something much worse...a life cursed with undeath for the sole purpose of incubating the very creatures responsible for her fate. Truly, this was...

Game Over...
13211112211211211211221121121213.title: A Loss of Balance means a Sudden End...

choices: She didn't find anyone at the station...
She encounters someone along the way...
13211112211211212.content:
Unfortunatley, as strong as Claire's will to fight was, she was simply too exhausted from the previous battle to stave off the will being pressed upon her.

"No!" She cried, witnessing her arms slowly undo the lock that had been keeping her clone at bay. "Can't. Stop!" Her shouts proved fruitless in spurring herself however, as her fingers at last undid the lock, and she fell back on her butt with a groan. Huffing and puffing at the exhaustion.

Much to her horror, her clone opened the door, red eyes filled with glee as it made its way out of the freezer and back into the store lobby.

"Well well Claire sweetie, I must say, I'm impressed! It giggled, before giving Claire an intense gaze, "Though I don't appreciate almost being frozen solid like that, but I can respect some quick thinking like yours.

As the clone drew even closer Claire tried desperately to get up, and nearly got herself to her feet, despite her exhaustion and added weight from the two blobs she had ingested minutes before. However, as soon as she had started to rise the clone shot a portion of itself into her mouth and forced her back down, Claire unable to scream as she felt herself being fed more of the blob.

Her belly rounded out into an even bigger curve and became heavy enough to the point that it forced her down to her knees, rendering her immobile.

"Honestly I thought about killing you here and now, the other Claire mused, "but after our little bout I figured you've displayed enough ingenuity to be of use, so instead I'm going to do something different!"

"Huff- what-urgh-what are you going to do?" Claire groaned, too lethargic to muster up any resistance towards her doppelganger.

"Well let's just say that instead of resisting us like you do currently, the clone grinned, before forming two more tendrils and placing them in Claire's ears, "I'm going to make sure you support our little cause!"

"What do you- AGH!" Claire screamed in pain, her vision blurring as she felt her doppelganger toy with her mind, rewiring thoughts and erasing memories and her goals before replacing them with new ones. Claire tried to stop the process somehow, jerking her head wildly to see if it would maybe, just maybe break the doppelganger's link, but to no avail.

Eventually, after a few minutes, the doppelganger withdrew the tentacles from Claire's mind, letting Claire's head drop as the girl panted heavily.

"There you see? All over now!" The doppelganger chided, apatting Claire's head as it began to walk past her. "Just a few memory rewrites and augmentations of your will and now you will be on our side!"

Claire, who had fallen unconscious, didn't respond. The clone, seeing this, simply smirked and morphed back into blob form before shuffling out of the store, back to its original mission of finding others to invade.

About an hour later, Claire finally woke up, groaning as she felt her head pounding as if a migrain had struck her.

"Ooh...what happened?" She whimpered, looking blearily around as she began to regain her bearings. "Last thing I remember was...was..." Claire paused, confused as to why she couldn't remember what she had been doing before she woke up.

Suddenly, a lightbulb went off as she remembered that she had been headed for the police station.

"That's right! I was heading for the police station! Maybe some other people will be there... and if there are..." She grinned, the thought of encountering others exciting her for reasons unknown to her.

"Well, no sense in sitting around here!" Claire declared eagerly standing up with no trouble at all despite her previously being immobile, though she didn't notice that fact as she walked out of the convinience store and headed towards the police station.

Once there...
13211112211211212.title: A Lack of Will Brings Servitude

1321111221121122.content:
Heading for the right door, Claire was about to wrap her hand around the doorknob when she saw the door pushed open, kocking her to the ground.

After landing on the linoleum floor with a resounding "oof!" and a whole medley of jiggling from her body, she looked up only to gasp in horror as she saw none other than one of the very things she'd been trying to avoid.

"Well well lookie what we have here!" The clone giggled mirthlessly as it sauntered over to the grounded heroine. "Didn't expect to see you up and about so soon!"

To Claire's credit, she had actually managed to jump up and even sprint away for about ten steps on pure adrenaline before her body reminded her that she was still 250 pounds and she stumbled to the ground and wheezed heavily.

"Well hey now!" The fake Claire whistled in surprise, "color me impressed! Didn't think you had it in ya to even jog, much less run! Albeit you didn't make it out of the store even but hey, nonetheless!"

Claire sat backed and tried to scoot away from the approaching foe, who sinply rolled her eyes and smiled sweetly at her cornered prey.

"Please," Claire pleaded, "let me...huff...let me go..."

"Sorry sweetie, no can do!" The other Claire shrugged, "You running around trying to stop us was a big no no!"

"But I wasn't trying to-" Claire started to protest.

"Well, so much for remaining skinny and sexy..." 'Claire' muttered to herself. "Though I guess the others will be glad to hear that I got the original's body...or maybe now I could be called the original..." 'Claire' giggled.

Walking outside, 'Claire' took a deep breath and looked around, seeing one of the other doppelgangers, she waved it over.

"Claire Redfield! You should-"

"Relax idiot," 'Claire' hissed, "I've already assumed control."

"So then..." The clone stopped and gave 'Claire' an inquisitive look.

"Yup, Claire Redfield as you knew her is no more!"

"Excellent!" the other clapped its hands in delight, "the others will be pleased to hear this!"

"Yeah, but for now..." 'Claire' chuckled darkly, before walking towards the police station, "let's go find some new...'friends'..."

154.content:
“Everybody out,”

The entire Tricell research team simultaneously stopped what they were doing to face the captivating form of their boss - Excella Gionne - standing the doorway of the main lab. Lately, she’d seemed a bit more annoyed than usual, but now she looked just a few steps shy of exploding with her jaw clenched, her brow furrowed, and her eyes practically searing holes into everyone in the room. Despite being a slender unimposing woman, her scowl froze the blood running in their veins and stilled their hearts.

Five seconds passed before Excella punctuated her sentence with “NOW!”

“M-Ms. Gionne,” A single scientist – brave enough to speak, but extremely cautious about choosing his words – addressed. “We’re…actually in the middle of Plagas research right now…”

“Not anymore,” Excella interrupted. “You are all relieved for the rest of the day. Go.”

“But-“

Excella groaned audibly. “You’ll still get paid for the rest of the day.” She said. “Now leave!”

“Ma’am, we’re on the verge of a major breakthrough right now.” The scientist continued; sounding a bit agitated. “If we stop now, we may never-“

“If you don’t shut up and leave right now, your leave will be permanent.” Excella shouted over the scientist. She shot glares across the room. “That goes for all of you! Why aren’t any of you moving? If you want to look at the Plagas so bad, maybe I should release it here so you can all get a better view.”

As Excella lifted her left arm to reveal a large metal suitcase griped tightly in her hand, everybody practically fell over in their seats in fear.

The color drained out of the scientist’s face. “Are you crazy? D…do you have any idea what that-”

“GO!”

The lab emptied almost instantly. Every last scientist dropped pencils, chairs, and research binders as they all rushed for the door; making sure to step gingerly pass Excella so as to not disturb her, or the dormant, yet deadly, Plagas dangling in her hand. As soon the last scientist turned the corner at the end of the hall, Excella made her way into the lab, sat at the main computer, and pulled up a folder simply labeled: UROBOROS. She navigated through the folder until she found a file containing the genetic data of the few subjects deemed compatible with the Uroborus virus. Excella stared at the file for a long time; not actually reading it, but just to delay what would come next. She didn’t want to know, but she had to be sure. Just to put her suspicions to rest.

As the genetic analyzer next to the computer booted up, Excella pulled a single hair out of her chignon bun, and fed it into the machine. She then sat down to longest five minutes of her life as the computer compared her DNA with the test subject’s. Her heart pounded against her chest, and her breathing got heavier as she watched the computer’s green progress bar inch closer and closer to the end of the window anxiously. When the computer finished its evaluation and revealed his finding to her, Excella’s heart stopped battering against her ribcage, and her face took on a frightening shade of crimson.

“INCOMPATIBLE?”

Excella nearly drove her fist through the computer’s monitor in her rage. Instead, she thundered: “Scan it again!”

Another five minutes passed, and then another, then another, but the results were the same each time: Excella’s DNA was incompatible with Uroborous. It was hard for Excella to accept the computer’s judgement, but wasn’t as if she hadn’t suspected the truth before. Otherwise, she wouldn’t even be here.

However, Excella wasn’t about to let genetics get in the way of her destiny. She closed the window showing her test results, and opened the suitcase she’d brought with her. Instead of a vial of dormant Plagas, the suitcase contained vials of PG67A/W: a serum her beloved Albert Wesker used to control the virus inside his body that presented him with amazing powers. She’d studied it extensively to replicate and manufacture an ample supply for her lover, so she figured she could modify it to allow her to control Uroborous, and not let it overwhelm her.

For the rest of the day, Excella remained in the lab – dressed in a hazmat suit one of the scientist left behind - hard at work designing her new virus. It had been a while since she’d actually done any genetic engineering work herself, but the more she worked, the more she recalled. Of course, Excella could have called her research team to come back and make the virus for her in a matter of hours, but she didn’t want anyone learning of her discordance with Uroborus; especially Wesker. She knew of course that Wesker would love her whether she was worthy of Uroburous or not, but she preferred to be a Queen he could take pride in.

When it came time to administer a bonding agent for the two viruses, something occurred to Excella. Perhaps she could use another virus to help control, maybe even enhance the effects Uroborus. The lab had a sample of every known variation of the Progenitor virus available to her. There was - of course - a very large possibility that something could go wrong, and she could possibly mutate into some horrible creature. However, she was positive that, with the antibodies Wesker had developed from that woman he captured, she could neutralize any ill effects.

But which virus would she use?

15522.content:
Annette was at her wit's end. Her husband had turned into a giant, rampaging monster, her colleagues were mostly all dead, Raccoon City and NEST were in emergency lock down and her daughter was stuck in the middle of her and her husband's mistakes.
Annette looked at the photo she held in her hand. It was of William, Sherry and herself. As she looked at it, tears formed in the corners of her eyes only to be wiped away with her sleeves. Now wasn't the time to be sentimental and as much as Annette wished she could change what happened, she knew she couldn't.
She knew what she could and needed to do though. She had to find Sherry (hopefully alive and well), she needed to escape this nightmare with her daughter and (most importantly) she had to find William and kill him before he could escape the city. As much as she hated the idea of killing her husband, it looked like she wouldn't have a choice. However, even if she wanted to, Annette knew she'd need more than a gun to put down G. It was because of this, she was in her lab with 3 pink vials vials containing what she hoped could help her in her mission, the F-Virus.
This virus was a bio weapon that she had been working on, prior to everything going to hell. It gave the user slow regenerative capabilities, strength to match a Tyrant and made those infected with the T-Virus ignore them. It sounded perfect, but there was a couple of flaws with the virus: any male test subjects infected with the virus died as the virus rejected them and any women test subjects would begin gaining weight and get gassy. It had been a problem that she had tried to solve but to no use.
"Now I'll never get the chance to perfect it." said Annette to herself as she gave a bitter laugh.
As much as Annette didn't want to become a giant gas ball, but from how everything looked she'd have to bite the bullet sooner or later.

The cafeteria had definitely seen better days. The lights had stopped working once the building went into lock down. The ground was littered with corpses and blood. On the floor, Annette could see a zombie chewing at someone's intestines. It reacted to the sound of the door opening, but when it looked at Annette, it was like she was invisible as it just ignored her and returned to their meal.
Annette shuffled around the deserted room, after eating whatever food she could find. After her binge, Annette sat down at one of the tables. She was currently taking off her belt to give her new belly more space. Upon doing so, Annette gave out a sigh of relief and gave out a small burp.
Annette looked down at her new body. While she hadn't eaten that much, obviously the F-Virus had affected her metabolism and how calories infected her body.
Her new belly made her look five months pregnant. As Annette looked at it, she was reminded of when she was pregnant with Sherry. Her breasts had gone from C cup to a D cup. 15533221212.content:
The Queen Zenobia. Once a cruise liner full of passengers, now all that remains of both the passengers and the crew were either dead...or mutated into grotesque monstrosities, courtesy of the V-Abyss virus. And unfortunately for FBC member Rachael Foley, things were about to get much worse for her. Within the bowels of the Queen Zenobia, Rachael lied there on the metallic floor, lifeless as a corpse and as bloated as a stuffed pig, with her belly filled to the brim with liquid infested with the V-Abyss virus.

However, that would soon be the least of her worries, as her body began to transform and alter into that of an Ooze, all while still retaining some physical aspects that identified her as Rachael Foley. Once she had fully transformed, Rachael quickly regained consciousness, exhaling hefty coughs in the process. "What...happened?" She asked herself, noticing that her voice sounded...different, as if it was echoing as she spoke.

But then, as she was about to stand up onto her feet, Rachael instantly noticed her mutated right hand and arm, shocking her greatly, where she then looked down at the rest of her body, only to see both the tattered remains of her black and yellow diver suit...and the mutated limbs that were once her human legs. "Mirror...Need to find...Mirror." She gasped, her capacity of sentient fully sentenced speech becoming limited, making her fears more profound, as she was able to stand upright, where she shambled across the small interior that was the Research Room, attempting to find anything to use as a makeshift mirror.

Fortunately for her, she was able to use a dead computer monitor as a makeshift mirror. However, Rachael surely wasn't going to like what she was about to see, and what had become of her, as the monitor screen revealed something quite horrendous: She was infected with the V-Abyss virus, She had become an Ooze! "No...NO...NOOO!!!" Rachael shrieked, reacting in a mix of great fear and rage, causing her to lash out with such distress, smashing the old computer into many pieces with her inhuman strength, as well as slicing at anything on the metallic table with her elongated clawed right hand!

In her current state of mind, Rachael felt like her worst fears had come true. After all, she had nightmares of experiencing what had transpired in Terragrigia, worried that she could become one of those horrific monsters she was running from on the Queen Zenobia before what she thought was her "death". Unfortunately for the Federal Bioterrorism Commission member, she was now experiencing a fate much worse than death. However, just as she thought her situation couldn't get any worse, Rachael was abruptly interrupted by...
15533221212.title: Oozing With Infection

choices: Feeling sorry for Rachael, Jill decided to help her.
Against her morality, Jill deserts Rachael to find a way off the Queen Zenobia.

155332212122.content:
Although, just as Rachael thought her current predicament couldn't get any worse than it already has, she then suddenly heard the all-too familiar sound of a semi-automatic handgun cocking back to load another bullet into the barrel. Of course, in the back of her mind, this clearly meant that someone that's still human was right next to her! "...Ray...mond?" She asked, her normal voice now meshed with this inhuman moaning, thinking that it was her FBC partner, Raymond.

However, it was far from the truth for Rachael. "Don't! Move." The assailant shouted, identifying herself as a woman, just as she then aimed the handgun toward Rachael's head, thinking that Rachael was going to attack her. Instead, upon turning her head to look at her assailant, Rachael didn't know that it was none other than BSAA member Jill Valentine, who clearly had made her way past some of the Ooze creatures lurking around the Queen Zenobia.

Nonetheless, Jill thought that Rachael was a threat, just as the same as the Ooze. So, in reaction to seeing a gun aimed at her face, Rachael became frightened, tripping on her mutated feet and instinctively crawled away from Jill while she wailed, "...Pleeease...Don't...KILL MEEE!!" Upon seeing the way that the Ooze in front of her was reacting, Jill couldn't help but become both shocked and surprised from this encounter, becoming aware that the single Ooze in front of her still retained some human sentience.

Shortly after regaining her composure, Jill became hesitant about shooting this specific Ooze, especially since she wasn't sure if it truly did retain sentience from it's previous life, or if it was simply using it's cowardice as a way to let her guard down so it could injure her, kill her, or worse. However, something in her gut told Jill to simply talk to what was essentially once human, see if it could understand her.

So, in an attempt to communicate with the creature before her, Jill slowly lowered her handgun away from Rachael and said, "...It's okay. I'm not going to hurt you." From there, Jill cautiously sheathed her pistol back into the holster, so the Ooze would be aware that she wasn't a threat to her, where Jill then spoke toward Rachael and said, "See? Not going to harm you. Name's Jill Valentine, I'm a member of the BSAA. Now... Care to tell me your name?"

"...Rach...Rachaeeeel...Foleyyyyy...F...B...C..." Rachael replied, revealing her identity to Jill Valentine, as well as confirming which faction she was a part of. Of course, Jill then realized that the Ooze in front of her was indeed Raymond's missing partner, where she then knelt down on one knee to speak toward Rachael and said, "Rachael Foley, huh? Then, that means you must be Raymond's partner who went missing in the bilge."

"...Ray...Raymond...Wheeere...where is... heeeee? Is...Is he...alriiiight?" Rachael asked, wondering if her red-haired partner was alive and well in the hellhole that was the Queen Zenobia. So, as a way to reassure her, Jill calmly spoke toward Rachael and answered, "Don't worry, he's very much alive and in one piece. He gave me this Iron Anchor Key so I can unlock certain doors. You know, he was...very worried about you, Rachael. And...I'm so sorry for what's happened to you. You couldn't see it, but...I was on the other side and I...I watched you die at the hands of those...things."

Fortunately, Rachael could see that look of sadness and sympathy on Jill's face, despite the disheartening revelation. However, just as she was about to respond to Jill's words of sympathy, Rachael witnessed a singular Ooze monster slither out of the airduct in the Research Room. But then, as the Ooze creature slowly stood upright, Rachael was experiencing this inhuman...hunger, as if her mutated body was demanding her to eat and consume the Ooze creature that slowly shambled it's way toward both her and the unsuspecting Jill.

So, in an attempt to warn Jill of the approaching danger, Rachael spoke up and said, "...Mooove..." "Excuse me?" Jill asked, confused as to why Rachael was saying that, unaware of the approaching Ooze monstrosity. In turn, the gluttonous hunger increased within Rachael, causing her to spring up onto her feet, as she knocked Jill off to the side while she shouted, "MOVE!!" From there, Jill quickly recovered, swiftly pulling out her holstered handgun in self-defense, only to witness what she assumed to be Rachael saving her ass from an Ooze monster.

However, what seemed the most disturbing about what Jill was witnessing, was the fact that Rachael seemed to be...eating the Ooze monster in her grasp, using her leech-like appendage to consume chunks of the Ooze's moist damp flesh. But it wasn't just the process itself that Jill took notice of, she also noticed that Rachael appeared to be getting somewhat fatter from consuming the Ooze monster, stretching the tattered remains of the diver suit, as Rachael's physique went from thin to downright chubby, complete with plump Double D-Cup breasts, a soft round belly, plump butt, and a pair of chubby legs and slightly plump arms.

Eventually, Rachael stopped "feeding" on the Ooze monster itself, dropping it on the metallic floor, where the Ooze corpse began to dissolve into a decent-sized puddle of red slime. Once that was all said and done, Rachael soon noticed her newfound softness and girth, gently poking her pudgy belly with her mutated right hand a few times, each poke making her more concerned and distressed. From there, she then looked back at Jill, who lowered her handgun away from Rachael once more, as the BSAA agent began to hear these sobbing noises from Rachael where she whimpered, "...Jill...Pleeeease...*whimper*...HELP MEEE!!"

So, to counter her partner's skepticism, Jill then spoke once more and replied, "First off, Parker: I'm standing right next to her. And second: I talked to her. Now, as for the bad news, Parker...he, um... doesn't exactly want to be near you, since he thinks you might, um... hurt him. I'm sorry."

Of course, despite Rachael's hindered capacity of intelligible speech due to her unwilling transformation, Jill understood what Rachael was telling her, where Jill then held Rachael's still-human left hand in reassurance and understand as she replied, "...I know you want to prove him wrong, Rachael. It's just that we need to play things a bit safe. After all, we're not sure if there are any side effects from you devouring those...those things. I mean, it might just make you more hostile toward humans if you keep eating anymore of those creatures. Okay?"

"Me...Don't...want to...hurrrt you...Jill. But...sooo...huuungrry..." Rachael said, becoming somewhat frightened at such an outcome, not wanting to harm the only human that didn't see her as a monster. "I know, Rachael. But you've got to fight the need to feed. Come on, we need to rendezvous with Parker at the elevator." Jill answered, as she then carefully guided Rachael out of the bloodied Research Room, and into the metal hallway interior of the Queen Zenobia, slowly but progressively making their way to Parker's current location.
